SourceText:
Your data is important to us. This privacy policy sets out our policies for the collection, use, and disclosure of personal data in the use of Mayor Konektá.

Please read this privacy policy carefully. By downloading or using the App, you confirm to be informed concerning the collection and use of personal data in relation to this policy. We will not use or share your personal data with anyone except as described in this privacy policy.

The terms used in this privacy policy have the same meanings as in our terms and conditions, unless otherwise defined in this privacy policy.

This Privacy Policy is drafted in accordance with the National ordinance personal data protection of Curaçao.
text:
Bo datonan ta importante pa nos. E polítika di privasidat aki ta stipulá nos maneho pa e kolekshon, uso i divulgashon di datonan personal den e uso di Mayor Konektá.

Por fabor lesa e polítika di privasidat akí kuidadosamente. Dor di 'download' òf usa e aplikashon, bo ta konfirmá di ta informá tokante e kolekshon i uso di datonan personal relashoná ku e polítika akí. Nos lo no usa òf kompartí bo datonan personal ku niun hende eksepto manera e ta deskribí den e polítika di privasidat akí.

E términonan usá den e polítika di privasidat aki tin e mesun nifikashonnan ku den nos términonan i kondishonnan, a ménos ku ta definí otro den e polítika di privasidat akí.

E Polítika di Privasidat akí ta traha konforme e ordenansa Nashonal di protekshon di dato personal di Kòrsou.
Kontroladó di dato

SourceText: What information does the app collect about you and how do we use it?
text: Ki informashon e aplikashon ta kolektá tokante di bo i kon nos ta us’é?

SourceText:
We only collect data that is adequate, relevant, and not excessive in relation to the processing purposes.

For the purpose of this privacy policy, 'personal data' means any information that enables us to identify an individual, directly or indirectly. We collect data as follows:
- Personal details (name; surname, location, organisation);
- Log data (IP address, device name)
- Users will collect caregivers’ name, phone number, age, and sex. 
We also collect information about the number and age of your children that, however, is not a personal data.


1. **Categories of personal data processed**:
      - Personal data
      - Contact data
      - Log data
      - or any further personal data necessary to assert or defend one's rights in civil, administrative or criminal proceedings

2. **Purposes of processing**:
      - Providing the App and support (to provide the App and parenting support including by communicating with you when you contact us). The legal basis is the performance of a contract, namely the Terms and Conditions
      - Maintaining technical logs for security and stability. The legal basis is legitimate interest 
      - Collecting caregivers’ details for programme facilitation. The legal basis is legitimate interest 
      - Protecting our rights and interests in case of litigation. The legal basis is legitimate interest 
      - Conducting statistical analyses and research with anonymised data. Feedback processing – you may provide us with feedback on the App. We always anonymise your personal information when sharing and publishing your feedback. The legal basis is legitimate interest.

3. **Legal Basis**:
      - Performance of a contract, namely the Terms and Conditions 
      - Legitimate interests to protect our rights and interests and to ensure updating and content accuracy of the App

4. **Data retention period**:
      - We retain personal data no longer than necessary for the purposes for which it was collected, and in any case no longer than four (4) years after your last use of the App, unless legal obligations require otherwise. 
      - Where caregiver data is collected indirectly by facilitators, we will inform the caregivers of the categories of data collected, the purposes for processing, and their rights in accordance with Article 26 of the National ordinance personal data protection..
text:
Nos ta kolektá solamente datonan ku ta adekuá, relevante i no eksesivo relashoná ku e propósitonan di prosesamentu.

Pa e propósito di e polítika di privasidat akí, ‘datonan personal’ ta nifiká kualke informashon ku ta permití nos identifiká un individuo, direktamente òf indirektamente. Nos ta kolektá dato di e siguiente manera:
- Detayenan personal (nòmber; fam, lugá, organisashon);
- Dato di registro (adrès IP, nòmber di aparato)
- Usuarionan lo kolekrtá nòmber, number di telefòn, edat i sekso di e dunadónan di kuido.
Nos ta kolektá tambe informashon tokante e kantidat i edat di bo yunan ku, sinembargo, no ta un dato personal.


1. **Kategorianan di datonan personal prosesá**:
- Datonan personal
- Detayenan di kontakto
- Dato di registro
- òf kualke otro dato personal nesesario pa afirmá òf defendé derechonan di un hende den prosedimentu sivil, atministrativo òf penal

2. **Propósitonan di prosesamentu**:
- Proveé ​​e Aplikashon i sosten (pa proveé ​​e Aplikashon i sosten di edukashon familiar inkluso komunikando ku bo ora bo tuma kontakto ku nos). E base legal ta e realisashon di un kontrato, esta e Términonan i Kondishonnan
- Mantenshon di registronan tékniko pa seguridat i stabilidat. E base hurídiko ta interes legítimo
- Kolektá detayenan di dunadónan di kuido pa fasilitashon di programa. E base hurídiko ta interes legítimo
- Protehá nos derechonan i interesnan den kaso di demanda. E base hurídiko ta interes legítimo
- Hasi anáisis i investigashon estadístiko ku datonan anónimo. Prosesamentu di komentario – bo por duna nos komentario riba e Aplikashon. Semper nos ta anonimisá bo informashon personal ora di kompartí i publiká bo komentario. E base hurídiko ta interes legítimo.

3. **Base Hurídiko**:
- Kumplimentu di un kontrato, esta e Términonan i Kondishonnan 
- Interesnan legítimo pa protehá nos derechonan i interesnan i pa garantisá aktualisashon i eksaktitut di kontenido di e Aplikashon

4. **Periodo di retenshon di dato**:
- Nos ta retené datonan personal no mas ku ta nesesario pa e propósitonan pa kua a kolektá nan i en todo kaso no mas ku kuater (4) aña despues di bo último uso di e Aplikashon, a ménos ku obligashonnan legal ta rekerí otro. 
- Kaminda ta kolektá dato di dunadó di kuido  indirektamente dor di fasilitadónan, nos lo informá e dunadónan di kuido di e kategorianan  di dato ku a kolektá, e propósitonan pa prosesamentu i nan derechonan di akuerdo ku artíkulo 26 di e ordenansa Nashonal protekshon di dato personal..

SourceText: Information sharing and third party service providers and websites
text: Kompartimentu di informashon i dunadónan di servisio di terser parti i wèpsaitnan

SourceText:
Your personal data may be shared with third parties such as researchers and partners involved in the improvement or implementation of the App including those outside your country. Prior to the disclosure of information with research partners we will make them anonymous. In reading this privacy policy, you acknowledge that we will use your anonymised data in published research.

Where personal data is transferred outside your country, we ensure that the destination provides an adequate level of protection. If not, we rely on Standard Contractual Clauses or another safeguard permitted under Article 64 of the National ordinance personal data protection. 

The App is supported by duly authorized third parties that may collect your personal data in order to provide their services. We do so for the following reasons:

-   To provide the App on our behalf;
-   To perform app-related services; or
-   To assist us in analysing how our App is used.

Links to the privacy policies of third-party service providers used by the App:
-   [Apple App Store Services](https://www.apple.com/legal/privacy/data/en/app-store/)
-   [Google Play Services](https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/)
-   [Google Analytics for Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/policies/analytics)
-   [Sentry](https://sentry.io/privacy/)
-   [Matomo](https://matomo.org/privacy-policy/)
-   [GlitchTip](https://glitchtip.com/legal/privacy)

This App may contain links to other sites that are not covered by this privacy policy. If you click on a third-party link, you will be directed to that site. This privacy policy applies only to the processing of your personal data by this App. It does not address, and we are not responsible for, the privacy, information, or other practices of any third parties, including any third party operating any site or service to which this App links to.

All third-party processors are contractually bound to confidentiality under Article 12 of the National ordinance personal data protection and must implement security consistent with Article 13 of the ordinance.
text:
Lo por kompartí bo bo datonan personal ku terser partidonan manera investigadónan i partnernan enbolbí den e mehorashon òf implementashon di e Aplikashon inkluyendo esnan pafó di bo pais. Promé ku e divulgashon di informashon na partnernan ku ta hasi investigashon nos lo hasi e informashon anónimo. Lesando e polítika di privasidat akí, bo ta rekonosé ku nos lo usa bo datonan anónimo den investigashon publiká.

Kaminda ta transferí datonan personal pafó di bo pais, nos ta sòru pa e destinashon duna un nivel di protekshon adekuá. Si no, nos ta dependé di Klóusulanan di Kontrato Standart òf un otro protekshon permití bou di Artíkulo 64 di e ordenansa Nashonal di protekshon di dato personal.

E Aplikashon ta sostené pa terser partidonan debidamente outorisá ku por kolektá bo datonan personal pa por duna nan servisio. Nos ta hasi esaki pa e siguiente motibunan:

- Pa proveé ​​e Aplikashon na nos nòmber;
- Pa duna servisio relashoná ku e aplikashon; òf
- Pa asistí nos den analisá nos den kon e Aplikashon ta wòrdu usá.

Lenknan pa e polítikanan di privasidat di dunadónan di servisio di terser parti ku e Aplikashon ta usa:
- [Apple App Store Services](https://www.apple.com/legal/privacy/data/en/app-store/)
- [Google Play Services](https://www.google.com/policies/privacy/)
- [Google Analytics for Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/policies/analytics)
- [Sentry](https://sentry.io/privacy/)
- [Matomo](https://matomo.org/privacy-policy/)
- [GlitchTip](https://glitchtip.com/legal/privacy)

E Aplikashon akí por kontené lenknan pa otro wèpsaitnan ku no ta kubri pa e polítika di privasidat akí. Si bo klek riba un lenk di terser partido, lo bo wòrdu dirigí na e wèpsait ei. E polítika di privasidat aki ta konta solamente pa e prosesamentu di bo datonan personal dor di e Aplikashon akí. E no ta atendé i nos no ta responsabel pa, e privasidat, informashon, òf otro práktikanan di kualke terser partido, inkluyendo kualke terser partido ku ta operá kualke wèpsait òf servisio na kua e Aplikashon aki ta lenk na dje.

Tur prosesadó di terser partido ta kontraktualmente mará na konfidensialidat bou di artíkulo 12 di e ordenansa Nashonal di protekshon di dato personal i mester implementá seguridat konsistente ku artíkulo 13 di e ordenansa.

SourceText: How long do we keep your data?
text: Kuantu tempu nos ta warda bo datonan?

SourceText: We will retain your personal information for as long as you continue to use the App and keep the App installed on your phone and as long as we need it to fulfill our purposes, including any relating to App services as well as legal, accounting, or reporting requirements. In any case, we will not process your data over 4 years after your last use of the App.
text: Nos lo keda ku bo informashon personal pa e periodo ku bo sigui usa e Aplikashon i ku bo tene e Aplikashon instalá riba bo telefòn i mientras ku nos mester di dje pa kumpli ku nos propósitonan, inkluyendo kualke proposito relashoná ku servisionan di Aplikashon i tambe rekisitonan legal, di kontabilidat òf di reportahe. En todo kaso, nos lo no prosesá bo datonan durante 4 aña despues di bo último uso di e Aplikashon.

SourceText: How do we keep your data secure?
text: Kon nos ta tene bo datonan sigur?

SourceText: We value your trust in providing us your personal information, thus we are striving to use commercially acceptable means of protecting it. We reserve the right to the storage of your data on third party servers or databases outside of the listed Mayor Konektá team (refer to the section on Third Party Service Providers and Websites) that provide security measures compliant with applicable privacy laws and regulations.
text: Nos ta balorá bo konfiansa den duna nos bo informashon personal, pues nos ta hasi esfuerso pa usa medionan komersialmente aseptabel pa proteh’é. Nos ta reservá e derecho riba e almasenahe di bo datonan riba "servernan" òf "data bases" di terser parti pafó di e lista di e tim di Mayor Konektá (referí na e sekshon riba Proveedornan di Servisio di Terser Parti i Wèpsaitnan) ku ta proveé medidanan di seguridat ku ta kumpli ku leinan i regulashonnan di privasidat aplikabel.
Cookie

SourceText:
Cookies are small files that store data, often used to save user-specific information. They allow websites and apps to retrieve this stored information, enabling a more personalised and efficient user experience.

Statistical cookies are processed based on legitimate interest, and are anonymised. Technical cookies are necessary for functioning of the App and cannot be disabled.

We use a number of third party services (see relevant section below) to support the functioning of the App. We use third party cookies through Firebase and GlitchTip and first party cookies through Matomo. In short, first-party cookies are from Mayor Konektá, and third-party cookies come from other places as described.

For further information on the handling of cookies see below:
- [GlitchTip](https://glitchtip.com/legal/privacy)
- [Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/support/privacy)
- [Matomo](https://matomo.org/blog/2020/02/web-analytics-cookies-gdpr/)

We use cookies for the following purposes: 
Functionality (so-called “technical cookies”). This type of cookies cannot be disable since allow the functionality of the App; 
Analysis (so-called “statistical cookies”) . This type of cookies allow the analysis of your choices and behaviour for statistical purposes. The data are aggregated and anonymized. 

You have the option to adjust your browser settings to decline all or specific browser cookies or to notify you when sites initiate or access cookies. For android devices this should be done on the google chrome app. Remember, disabling cookies can affect the functionality of websites or web apps, as they may rely on these cookies for essential features.
text:
'Cookies' ta archivonan chikí ku ta warda dato, hopi bia usá pa warda informashon spesífiko di usuario. Nan ta permití wèpsaitnan i aplikashonnan pa rekuperá e informashon wardá akí loke ta permití un eksperensia di usuario mas personalisá i efisiente.

Ta prosesá 'cookies' di estadístika a base di interes legítimo i nan ta anonimisá. 'Cookies' tékniko ta nesesario pa funshonamentu di e Aplikashon i no por desakitva esaki nan. 

Nos ta usa un kantidat di servisio di terser partido (wak sekshon relevante mas abou) pa sostené e funshonamentu di e Aplikashon. Nos ta usa 'cookie' di terser partido pa medio di Firebase i GlitchTip i 'cookie' di promé partido pa medio di Matomo. Pa resumí, 'cookie' di promé partido ta di Mayor Konektá, i 'cookie' di terser parti ta bini di otro kaminda manera deskribí.

Pa mas informashon tokante e maneho di 'cookie' wak akí abou:
- [GlitchTip](https://glitchtip.com/legal/privacy)
- [Firebase](https://firebase.google.com/support/privacy)
- [Matomo](https://matomo.org/blog/2020/02/web-analytics-cookies-gdpr/)

Nos ta usa 'cookie' pa e siguiente propósitonan:
Funshonalidat (asina yamá “'cookie' tékniko”). No por desaktivá e tipo di 'cookie' akí ya ku e ta hasi posibel e funshonalidat di e Aplikashon;
Análisis (asina yamá “'cookie' di estadístika”). E tipo di 'cookie' akí ta hasi posibel análisis di bo eskohonan i komportashon pa propósitonan estadístiko. Ta agregá e datonan i ta hasi nan anónimo.

Bo tin e opshon pa ahustá konfirgurashonnan di bo 'browser' pa rechasá tur 'cookie' òf 'cookies' spesífiko di 'browser' òf pa notifiká bo ora wèpsaitnan inisiá òf aksesá 'cookie'. Pa aparatonan 'android' mester hasi esaki riba e aplikashon di google chrome. Kòrda, desaktivashon di 'cookie' por afektá e funshonalidat di wèpsaitnan òf aplikashonnan di wèp, ya ku nan por ta dependé di e 'cookies' akí pa funshonnan esensial.
Privasidat di Mucha

SourceText: The App is intended for adults. If minors use the App, their data may only be processed with the consent of a legal representative in accordance with Article 5 of the National ordinance personal data protection. We do not knowingly collect personally identifiable information from individuals under 18 unless we have the consent of a legal representative.
text: E Aplikashon ta destiná pa adultonan. Si menornan ta usa e Aplikashon, por prosesá nan datonan solamente ku konsentimentu di un representante legal di akuerdo ku artíkulo 5 di e ordenansa Nashonal protekshon di datonan personal. Nos no ta kolektá informashon personalmente identifikabel di personanan bou di 18 aña a ménos ku nos tin e konsentimentu di un representante legal.
Bo derechonan di protekshon di dato

SourceText:
Under data protection law, you have rights including:

Your right of access - You have the right to ask us for copies of your personal information.

Your right to rectification - You have the right to ask us to rectify personal information you think is inaccurate. You also have the right to ask us to complete information you think is incomplete.

Your right to erasure - You have the right to ask us to erase your personal information in certain circumstances.

Your right to withdraw consent for data processing at any time - You can choose to halt the processing of your data if consent was the legal basis for handling your information.

Your right to restriction of processing - You have the right to ask us to restrict the processing of your personal information in certain circumstances.

Your right to object to processing - You have the right to object to the processing of your personal information in certain circumstances.

Your right to data portability - You have the right to ask that we transfer the personal information you gave us to another organisation, or to you, in certain circumstances.

You are not required to pay any charge for exercising your rights. Depending on the circumstances and the nature of your request it may not be possible for us to do what you have asked, for example, where there is a statutory or contractual requirement for us to process your data and it would not be possible to fulfil our legal obligations if we were to stop. Further information on your rights is available from the Personal Data Protection Supervisory Committee.

You may exercise your rights (access, correction, deletion, objection, restriction, portability) by contacting: info@parentingforlifelonghealth.org. 
We will respond within four weeks, as required under Article 27(1) of the National ordinance personal data protection.
We may request additional information to verify your identity.
text:
Bou di lei di protekshon di dato, bo tin derechonan inkluyendo:

Bo derecho di akseso - Bo tin e derecho di pidi nos kopianan di bo informashon personal.

Bo derecho riba rektifikashon - Bo tin e derecho di pidi nos pa drecha informashon personal ku bo ta kere no ta eksakto. Tambe bo tin derecho di pidi nos pa kompletá informashon ku bo ta kere ta inkompleto.

Bo derecho di eliminá - Bo tin e derecho di pidi nos pa eliminá bo informashon personal den sierto sirkunstansianan.

Bo derecho di kita konsentimentu pa prosesamentu di dato na kualke momento - Bo por skohe pa stòp e prosesamentu di bo datonan si konsentimentu tabata e base legal pa manehá bo informashon.

Bo derecho riba restrikshon di prosesamentu - Bo tin e derecho di pidi nos pa restringí e prosesamentu di bo informashon personal den sierto sirkunstansianan.

Bo derecho di oponé prosesamentu - Bo tin e derecho di oponé prosesamentu di bo informashon personal den sierto sirkunstansianan.

Bo derecho riba portabilidat di dato - Bo tin e derecho di pidi pa nos transferí e informashon personal ku bo a duna nos na un otro organisashon, òf na abo, den sierto sirkunstansianan.

Bo no ta obligá di paga ningun kosto pa ehersé bo derechonan. Dependiendo di e sirkunstansianan i e naturalesa di bo petishon kisas no ta posibel pa nos hasi loke bo a pidi, por ehèmpel, kaminda tin un rekisito statutario òf kontraktual pa nos prosesá bo datonan i e lo no ta posibel pa kumpli ku nos obligashonnan legal si nos lo mester stòp. Mas informashon tokante bo derechonan ta optenibel serka e Komité di Supervishon di Protekshon di Datonan Personal.

Bo por ehersé bo derechonan (akseso, korekshon, eliminashon, opheshon, restrikshon, portabilidat) dor di tuma kontakto ku: info@parentingforlifelonghealth.org. Nos lo kontestá denter di kuater siman, manera ta rekerí bou di artíkulo 27(1) di e ordenansa Nashonal protekshon di dato personal.
Nos por pidi informashon adishonal pa verifiká bo identidat.
note: The string info@parentingforlifelonghealth.org. should not be translated.

text: Tumamentu di Desishon Outomatisá

SourceText: The App does not make decisions that have legal or significant effects based solely on automated processing.
text: E Aplikashon no ta tuma desishonnan ku tin efektonan legal òf signifikante basá solamente riba prosesamentu outomatisá.
Kita e aplikashon

SourceText:
We are sorry if you find our App no longer useful. Should you decide to remove our App, we may still retain some of your data (although anonymised) to troubleshoot, aid in investigations, comply with legal requirements or to add to our existing research data sets.
Uninstalling the app does not automatically delete personal data stored in accordance with lawful retention requirements.
text: Nos diskulpa si bo no ta haña nos aplikashon útil mas. Si bo disidí di kita nos Aplikashon, nos por retené algun di bo datonan (ounke anónimo) pa solushoná problema, yuda den investigashonnan, kumpli ku rekisitonan legal òf pa agregá na nos sètnan di dato di investigashon eksistente. Kitando e aplikashon no ta outomatikamente eliminá datonan personal wardá, di akuerdo ku e rekisitonan di retenshon legal.
Kambionan na @global.privacy_policy
note: The string @global.privacy_policy should not be translated.

SourceText: We may update our privacy policy from time to time. We will notify you in advance of any substantial change will occur. Please review this page periodically for any updates.
text: Nos por aktualisá nos polítika di privasidat de bes en kuando. Nos lo notifiká bo di antemano di kualke kambio supstansial ku lo tuma lugá. Por fabor revisá e página aki periodikamente pa kualke aktualisashon.
Tuma Kontakto Ku Nos

SourceText:
If you have any questions or suggestions about our privacy policy or terms and conditions, do not hesitate to contact us at <info@parentingforlifelonghealth.org>.

If your concerns are not adequately addressed, you retain the right to file a complaint with the Personal Data Protection Supervisory Committee under Article 48 of the National ordinance personal data protection. You can contact them via info@cbpcuracao.org
text:
Si bo tin kualke pregunta òf sugerensia tokante nos polítika di privasidat òf términonan i kondishonnan, no duda pa tuma kontakto ku nos na <info@parentingforlifelonghealth.org>.

Si no ta atendé ku bo bo preokupashonnan adekuadamente, bo tin e derecho di entregá un keho na e Komité di Supervishon di Protekshon di Datonan Personal bou di Artíkulo 48 di e ordenansa Nashonal di protekshon di datonan personal. Bo por tuma kontakto ku nan via info@cbpcuracao.org
note:
The following strings should not be translated:
<info@parentingforlifelonghealth.org>.
info@cbpcuracao.org

text: Akuerdo di Usuario

SourceText:
These terms and conditions are an agreement between you and Parenting for Lifelong Health (“PLH”) which furthermore sets out the rules for your use of  Mayor Konektá (or “App”).

Mayor Konektá is a free app version of the PLH programme and designed for facilitators delivering the Mayor Konektá programme.

Mayor Konektá is brought to you by the collaboration of partners including the Ministry of Social Development, Labour and Welfare (SOAW), UNICEF the Netherlands and IDEMS International. (‘ Mayor Konektá team’).

Please read these terms and conditions carefully. By downloading or using the App, you agree that you have read, understood, and accepted the terms and conditions contained below.

For the purpose of the National ordinance personal data protection of Curaçao, PLH, SOAW and UNICEF NL jointly act as the responsible parties.

Your privacy is important to us – please also read our privacy policy, which will detail how we collect, store and use the information that you provide to us. Your rights under the National ordinance personal data protection can be found in our Privacy Policy. By using Mayor Konektá you are confirming to us that you reviewed our privacy policy, as set out separately.
text:
E términonan i kondishonnan aki ta un akuerdo entre abo i Parenting for Lifelong Health (“PLH”) ku mas aleu ta stipulá e reglanan pa bo uso di Mayor Konektá (òf “Aplikashon”).

Mayor Konektá ta un vershon di aplikashon grátis di e programa di PLH i diseñá pa fasilitadónan ku ta fasilitá e programa di Mayor Konektá.

Mayor Konektá ta wòrdu tresé serka bo dor di kolaborashon di partnernan entre otro Ministerio di Desaroyo Sosial, Labor i Bienestar (SOAW), UNICEF Hulanda i IDEMS Internashonal. (‘E tim di Mayor Konektá’).

Por fabor lesa e términonan i kondishonnan akí kuidadosamente. Dor di 'download' òf usa e App, bo ta bai di akuerdo ku bo a lesa, komprondé i aseptá e términonan i kondishonnan detayá akí bou.

Pa e propósito di e ordenansa Nashonal protekshon di dato personal di Kòrsou, PLH, SOAW i UNICEF NL konhuntamente ta fungi komo e partidonan responsabel.

Bo privasidat ta importante pa nos – por fabor lesa tambe nos polítika di privasidat, ku lo detayá kon nos ta kolektá, warda i usa e informashon ku bo ta duna nos. Por haña bo derechonan bou di e ordenansa Nashonal protekshon di dato personal den nos Polítika di Privasidat. Reglanan di Uso

SourceText: Mayor Konektá is open-source, which means that its codebase can be found on GitHub for the wider software developer community. However, it's against the terms of use to alter the existing application or its materials, or to replicate any trademarks from the Mayor Konektá team. Although open source, refrain from translating the software into other languages or creating alternate versions without crediting the Mayor Konektá team. Unauthorised access to confidential user data is forbidden. It's not acceptable to provide false information about yourself when using the App, make unfounded claims of affiliation, or inaccurately report the App’s behaviour. Ensure that your usage of the App adheres to all local rules and laws. This app is intended for adult users as a policy choice. If you are a minor, you should not use the app without the consent of your legal representative.

SourceText:

SourceText:
Hi! Thank you for volunteering to lead the group discussions. 

*While engaging with other parents in the group, keep the following in mind*: 

👋 Greet parents when engaging with them.

💛 Respect what participants share and be aware of different ages, genders, values and circumstances. 

🏅 Encourage parents to share and respond to each other - and praise them for it.

🔔 Remind parents of ground rules when needed.

🔑 Model the behaviour you want to see among the parents.
text:

👋 Saludá mayornan ora bo ta atendé ku nan.

💛 Respetá loke e partisipantenan ta kompartí i ta konsiente di diferente edat, sekso, balor i sirkunstansia.

🏅 Enkurashá mayornan pa kompartí i kontestá otro - i elogiá nan pa esaki.

🔔 Kòrda mayornan riba reglanan básiko ora ta nesesario.

🔑 Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke mira serka e mayornan.

text:
Aki bo por haña algun instrukshon ku bo por usa ku e grupo di mayor: 

🎉Laga nos selebrá nos éksitonan! Kiko tabata algu positivo ku bo a eksperensiá ora bo a purba un di e abilidatnan di @global.prog_name ku bo yu?

🌱Purba abilidatnan nobo por ta difísil na kumisamentu. Kiko tabata algu *difísil* ku bo a eksperensiá ora bo a purba un abilidat @global.prog_name ku bo yu na kas?

💙Bo ta bon biní pa usa e espasio di WhatsApp aki pa kompartí kualke pregunta òf eksperensia ku bo tin durante bo biahe di @global.prog_name. Kòrda, kisas no ta semper mi por kontestá, pero esaki ta nos grupo – *huntu nos por haña tur e kontestanan ku nos mester*!
Mensahe Alternativo di Klousura

SourceText:
Thank you for sharing your thoughts 💙

Since we don’t have any volunteers for group admin, I will be closing this WhatsApp Support Group at the end of the Programme. 

Remember, you can still continue your @global.prog_name journey with your family!
text:
Danki pa kompartí bo pensamentunan 💙

Komo ku nos no tin ningun boluntario pa atministrá e grupo, mi lo sera e Grupo di Sosten di WhatsApp aki na final di e Programa. 

Kòrda, bo por sigui bo biahe di @global.prog_name ku bo famia!
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Hello 👋

Thank you for sharing your thoughts about the programme. I’m sorry that you’re facing challenges. Here are a couple of things you can try: 

1️⃣If there’s a skill or goal that you are finding difficult, remember you can always go back and rewatch the stories. Practice makes perfect! ✨

2️⃣If you feel comfortable, please feel free to chat about the areas you’re finding tough with your peers in the WhatsApp Support Group. Your peers might have some helpful tips 👍

Remember, everyone’s learning journey is unique, and change takes time. But trust me, if you keep practising the skills you’ve learned, you’ll start to see progress. 🏅
text:
Kon ta bai? 👋

Danki pa kompartí bo pensamentunan tokante e programa. Mi ta lamentá ku bo ta topa retonan. Akí tin un par di kos ku bo por purba: 

1️⃣Si tin un abilidat òf meta ku bo ta haña difísil, kòrda ku semper bo por bai bèk i wak e historianan di nobo. Mas bo praktiká, mas mihó bo ta bira! ✨

2️⃣Si bo ta sintí bo kómodo, por fabor sintí bo liber pa kòmbersá ku otronan den e Grupo di Sosten di WhatsApp, tokante e áreanan ku bo ta haña difísil. Nan por tin algun tep útil 👍

Kòrda, tur hende ta siña na otro manera i kambio ta tuma tempu. Pero konfiá mi, si bo sigui praktiká e abilidatnan ku bo a siña, lo bo kuminsá mira progreso. 🏅
Mensahe di Sosten

SourceText:
Hello 👋

Thank you for sharing your feelings. 
It’s okay to have fears or feel sad when something you’ve been a part of is ending. 

Remember, 

1️⃣Even though @global.prog_name is ending, your journey can continue. You have gained some ⭐amazing ⭐parenting skills that you can carry with you. 

2️⃣The WhatsApp group can be a source of support well beyond the programme. Keep sharing your success and struggles in the WhatsApp Support Group, or with your peers. 

3️⃣If you ever want to go back to any parenting skills or goals, you are review our chats. Practise makes perfect ✨

You did great throughout your @global.prog_name journey!
text:
Kon ta bai?👋

Danki pa kompartí bo sintimentunan. 
Ta di komprondé ku bo ta sintí bo insigur òf tristu ora algu ku bo tabata parti di dje ta bai kaba. 

Kòrda, 

1️⃣Ounke @global.prog_name ta bai kaba, bo biahe por sigui. Bo a haña algun abilidat di edukashon familiar ⭐maravioso ⭐ku bo por sigui usa. 

2️⃣E grupo di WhatsApp por ta un fuente di sosten ku ta bai mucho mas leu ku e programa. Sigui kompartí bo éksito i lucha den e Grupo di Sosten di WhatsApp, òf ku e otronan. 

3️⃣Si lo bo kier wak kualke abilidat òf meta di edukashon familiar bèk, bo por repasá nos kòmbersashonnan. Mas bo praktiká, mas mihó bo ta bira!✨

Bo a hasi un hopi bon trabou durante henter bo trayekto di @global.prog_name!

SourceText:
The structure and content of this current programme were drawn and adapted from the following key resource materials:

Lachman, J. & Hutchings, J. (2018) _Parenting for Lifelong Health Programme for Young Children – Facilitator Manual_. European Version. Fifth Edition

Lachman, J. & Hutchings, J. (2017). _Parenting for Lifelong Health Programme for Young Children. Parent Handbook_. Fourth Edition

Linehan, M. (2020). _DBT skills training manual: for the therapist. (1st ed)_. EDULP, 2020. Digital book, EPUB

SourceText: How you facilitate matters the most
text: Kon bo ta fasilitá e seshon ta loke ta mas importante

SourceText: The app is a guide to support you after your facilitator training. Remember, HOW you facilitate matters most. Delivering the content is only about 20% of the programme’s success. The other 80% depends on HOW you facilitate—your attitude, your empathy, and how you connect with and support parents throughout their journey.
text: E aplikashon ta un guia pa sostené bo despues di bo treinen komo fasilitadó. Kòrda ku e manera KON bo ta fasilitá ta loke ta mas importante. Duna e kontenido ta solamente alrededor di 20% di e éksito di e programa. E otro 80% ta dependé di e manera KON bo ta fasilitá—bo aktitut, bo empatia i kon bo ta konektá ku i sostené mayornan durante henter nan trayekto.
Sigui siña i praktiká

SourceText:
Remember that if there is anything that you cannot remember or feel unsure of, practice it with another facilitator or ask your supervisor/coach. 

Just as we say to the parents, “It is what you do at home that makes the difference,” the same thing applies to you. 

When you practice facilitation skills before a module, you will be more confident and able to deliver the programme for parents.
text:
Kòrda ku si tin algu ku bo no por kòrda òf ku bo ta sintí bo insigur di dje, praktik’é ku un otro fasilitadó òf puntra bo supervisor/'coach'. 

Meskos ku nos ta bisa e mayornan, “Ta loke bo ta hasi na kas ta hasi e diferensia,” e mésun kos ta konta pa abo tambe. 

Ora bo praktiká abilidatnan di fasilitashon promé ku e módulo, lo bo ta mas sigur di bo mes i kapas pa fasilitá e programa pa mayornan.

SourceText: Apply the skills in your own life
text: Apliká e abilidatnan den bo mes bida

SourceText:
It is also important that you practice the skills from the programme with your own children and teens at home (if you have any). You may also find that many of the skills are applicable and helpful in creating positive relationships with others, such as your colleagues, friends, and loved ones!  

Thank you for your commitment and dedication to reducing violence against children and promoting child wellbeing through positive parenting. You are a shining star for happy families!
text:
Tambe ta importante pa bo praktiká e abilidatnan di e programa ku bo mes yunan i tinernan na kas (si bo tin). Bo por haña tambe ku hopi di e abilidatnan ta aplikabel i útil pa krea relashonnan positivo ku otronan, manera bo koleganan, amigunan i sernan kerí!

Danki pa bo kompromiso i dedikashon pa redusí violensia kontra mucha i promové bienestar di mucha dor di edukashon familiar positivo. Bo ta un strea briante pa famianan felis!

SourceText: Step 1: Create a parent group in the App
text: Stap 1: Krea un grupo di mayor den e App

SourceText:
This sets up the space where you’ll manage all parents in your group.

1️⃣ Go to _Groups_
2️⃣ Select _Create New Group_
3️⃣ Enter the basic details of the group: group name, age group (young children, teens, or mixed) and delivery format (all remote, with in-person opening or closing, or both)
4️⃣ Save your new group 

👉 This is now the “home” where you’ll manage everything for this parent group.
text:
Esaki ta bira e espasio kaminda bo ta atendé ku tur mayor den bo grupo.

1️⃣ Bai na _Gruponan_
2️⃣ Selektá _Krea Grupo Nobo_
3️⃣ Hinka e detayenan básiko di e grupo: nòmber di grupo, grupo di edat (mucha yòn, hóben, òf kombiná) i forma di duna e seshonnan (tur hende riba distansia, en persona ku un apertura i klousura òf tur dos)
4️⃣ "Save" bo grupo nobo 

👉 Esaki awor ta e “kas” kaminda bo ta atendé ku tur kos pa e grupo di mayor aki.
Etapa 2: Hiba Konsultanan Individual

SourceText:
Before the programme begins, call or message each parent.

Use this time to:
1️⃣ Explain what the programme is about and how it will be delivered (through WhatsApp group sessions and activities at home).
2️⃣ Share what parents can expect each week (videos, home activities, and group chats).
3️⃣ Answer any questions or concerns they may have.
4️⃣ Collect basic information about the parent, their child, and family situation.
5️⃣ Build a friendly and trusting relationship.
6️⃣ Encourage them to participate actively in the WhatsApp group.

💡 Tip: Follow the Individual Consultation Guide for sample questions and key points to cover.
text:
Promé ku e programa kuminsá, yama òf manda un mensahe pa kada mayor.

Usa e tempu aki pa:
1️⃣ Splika kiko e programa ta i kon ta bai duna esaki (pa medio di seshonnan den grupo di WhatsAppi i tareanan pa hasi na kas).
2️⃣ Kompartí loke mayornan por spera tur siman (vidionan, tareanan pa hasi na kas, i 'chat' den grupo).
3️⃣ Kontestá kualke pregunta òf prekupashon ku nan por tin.
4️⃣Tuma informashon básiko tokante e mayor, su yu, i situashon di famia.
5️⃣ Konstruí un relashon amistoso i di konfiansa.
6️⃣ Enkurashá nan pa partisipá aktivamente den e grupo di WhatsApp.

💡 Tip: Sigui e Guia di Konsulta Individual pa ehèmpelnan di pregunta  i puntonan klave pa kubri.
Etapa 3: Kompletá e profilnan di mayor

SourceText:
During or after each consultation, open your parent group in the app. 

1️⃣ Tap _Add Caregiver_
2️⃣ Fill in the Caregiver Profile 
3️⃣ Save the profile 
4️⃣ Repeat for each caregiver in the group

This profile captures important background information about the parent, child, and family situation.
text:
Durante òf despues di kada konsulta, habri bo grupo di mayor den e aplikashon. 

1️⃣ Primi _Agregá Edukadó/Mayor_
2️⃣ Yena e Profil di e Edukadó/Mayor 
3️⃣ 'Save' e profil 
4️⃣Ripití pa kada edukadó den e grupo

E profil aki ta rekopilá informashon general importante tokante e mayor, e yu i e situashon di famia.
Etapa 4: Krea e Grupo di WhatsApp

SourceText:
Save parents’ names and WhatsApp numbers (if available) on your phone

Create your WhatsApp group with a temporary name, icon, and description.
text:
Warda nòmber i number di WhatsApp di mayornan (si ta disponibel) riba bo telefòn

Krea bo grupo di WhatsApp ku un nòmber, símbolo i deskripshon temporal.
Usa aserkamentu di kolaborashon pa siña

SourceText:
In many other programmes, facilitators tell participants what to do and why it is important.

In @global.prog_name, we do things differently. We like to think of this as a collaborative and participatory approach to learning. As facilitators, you are collaborators or partners working with mothers, fathers, and caregivers to identify plans and practice solutions that will help them improve their lives at home.

It is helpful to think of mothers, fathers, and caregivers as experts who know their own children and circumstances. Many mothers, fathers, and caregivers will already be practising many positive ways of parenting their children. Others will be able to identify ways of improving their parenting on their own with guidance.

Our job is to support mothers, fathers, and caregivers learn for themselves how to achieve their goals. This sometimes means we have to work harder to ask the right sort of open-ended questions that will help mothers, fathers, and caregivers work out the benefits of positive parenting and nonviolent discipline for their children.

When mothers, fathers, and caregivers teach themselves, they learn a skill that will help them for a long time after the programme ends.
text:
Den hopi otro programa, fasilitadónan ta bisa partisipantenan kiko pa hasi i dikon e ta importante.

Den @global.prog_name, nos ta hasi kosnan diferente. Nos ta mira esaki komo un aserkamentu di kolaborashon i partisipashon pa siña. Komo fasilitadó, boso ta kolaboradó òf partner ku ta traha ku mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan pa identifiká plannan i praktiká solushonnan ku lo yuda nan mehorá nan bida na kas.

Ta bon pa pensa riba mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan komo ekspertonan ku konosé nan mes yunan i sirkunstansianan. Hopi mama, tata i edukadónan lo ta praktiká hopi manera positivo di edukashon familiar ku nan yunan kaba. Otronan lo por identifiká maneranan pa mehorá nan edukashon familiar riba nan mes ku guia.

Nos trabou ta pa sostené mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan pa siña riba nan mes kon pa logra nan metanan. Tin bia esaki ta nifiká ku nos mester traha mas duru pa hasi e preguntanan habrí korekto ku lo yuda mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan traha riba e benefisionan di edukashon familiar positivo i disiplina no violento pa nan yunan.

Ora mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan mes ta siña nan mes, nan ta siña un abilidat ku lo yuda nan pa hopi tempu despues ku e programa terminá.
note: The string @global.prog_name, should not be translated.

SourceText: Model the behaviour you want to see
text: Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke mira

SourceText:
The modelling principle forms the foundation of how we deliver @global.prog_name.

If we lead sessions in a collaborative approach, praise mothers, fathers, and caregivers often, practise active listening, and use positive instructions, mothers, fathers, and caregivers will do the same with their children.

Likewise, if we tell mothers, fathers, and caregivers what to do, criticise or laugh at them, ignore their needs or concerns, or only say what we do not want them to do, they will do the same.

Practise relaxation activities to help reduce your own stress. It can even just be taking a deep breath. Mothers, fathers, and caregivers will learn from your example and begin to mirror your behaviour.

In many ways, you are parenting the mothers, fathers, and caregivers in the way that you would like them to parent their children. It really works!
text:
E prinsipio di duna ehèmpel ta forma e fundeshi di kon nos ta implementá @global.prog_name.

Si nos guia seshonnan den un aserkamentu di kolaborashon, elogiá mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan ku frekuensia, praktiká skucha aktivo i usa instrukshonnan positivo, mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan lo hasi meskos ku nan yunan.

Asina tambe, si nos bisa mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan kiko pa hasi, kritiká òf hari nan, ignorá nan nesesidatnan òf preokupashonnan, òf solamente bisa loke nos no ke pa nan hasi, nan lo hasi meskos.

Praktiká aktividatnan di relahashon pa yuda redusí bo propio strès. E por asta ta djis hala un rosea profundo. Mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan lo siña for di bo ehèmpel i kuminsá kopia bo komportashon.

Na hopi manera, bo ta edukando e mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan segun bo ke pa nan eduká nan yunan. E ta funshoná di bèrdat!
note: The string @global.prog_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Go at the pace of the group
text: Bai segun e ritmo di e grupo

SourceText:
You should always go at your mothers, fathers, and caregivers’ pace when delivering the programme. Make sure that the mothers, fathers, and caregivers in your group have understood the current content before moving on to new content.

This may mean that you take extra time problem-solve issues that come up during the sessions.
text:
Semper bo mester bai segun e ritmo di e mama, tata i edukadónan ora di implementá e programa. Sòru pa e mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan den bo grupo a komprondé e kontenido aktual promé ku pasa pa kontenido nobo.

Esaki por nifiká ku bo ta tuma tempu èkstra pa solushoná problemanan ku ta surgi durante e seshonnan.

SourceText: Make @global.prog_name a happy and safe space to learn
text: Hasi @global.prog_name un espasio dushi i sigur pa siña
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Everyone likes a place that is warm and inviting. Tips for facilitators to make @global.prog_name a happy place to learn:

1️⃣ Invite mothers, fathers, and caregivers to participate: Notice when someone is holding back and ask if he or she wishes to share an opinion or experience.

2️⃣ Mention that this is a safe and empathetic space where no one will be judged. Experiences shared within the group will be kept confidential.

3️⃣ Make sure that everyone in the room can hear you (and each other).

4️⃣ Sit when you are talking. Be on the same level as the mothers, fathers, and caregivers and sit among them. If possible, try to sit among the mothers, fathers, and caregivers instead of at the front of the group.

5️⃣ Create a comfortable and welcoming place to meet.

6️⃣ Make sure there are enough chairs and that the room is clean. In the summer, use a fan or an air conditioner (if available). You can even decorate the room if you want!

7️⃣ Establish the language needs of the participants.

8️⃣ Respect whatever a parent shares with the group.

9️⃣ There will be lots of laughter in the group but try to laugh with not at a parent even if what they say sounds ridiculous. 

🔟Praise mothers, fathers, and caregivers for their effort and dedication.

1️⃣1️⃣ Model the behaviour you want from the mothers, fathers, and caregivers in the way that you treat them.

1️⃣2️⃣ Praise, respect, and reflect on mothers, fathers, and caregivers’ contributions.
text:
Tur hende ta gusta un lugá ku ta kaluroso i kaminda bo ta sintí bo bon biní. Tepnan pa fasilitadónan pa hasi @global.prog_name un lugá dushi pa siña:

1️⃣ Invitá mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan pa partisipá: Tuma nota ora un hende ta kontené su mes i puntr'é si e ta deseá di kompartí un opinion òf eksperensia.

2️⃣ Menshoná ku esaki ta un espasio seif i ku empatia kaminda lo no husga niun hende. Eksperensianan kompartí den e grupo lo keda konfidensial.

3️⃣ Sòru pa tur hende den e kamber por tendé bo (i tende otro).

4️⃣ Sinta ora bo ta papia. Ta na e mésun nivel ku e mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan i sinta meimei di nan. Si ta posibel, purba di sinta meimei di e mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan na lugá di sinta dilanti di e grupo.

5️⃣ Krea un lugá kómodo i akohedó pa topa otro. (kaminda tur hende por sinti su mes na kas).

6️⃣ Sòru pa tin sufisiente stul i ku e kamber ta limpi. Den temporada di hopi kalor, usa un fèn òf un èrko (si esakinan ta disponibel). Bo por asta dekorá e kamber si bo ke!

7️⃣ Establesé e nesesidatnan di idioma di e partisipantenan.

8️⃣ Respetá loke ku un mayor ta kompartí ku e grupo.

9️⃣ Lo tin hopi harimentu den e grupo pero purba hari ku e mayor i no hari e mayor ounke loke nan ta bisa ta zona ridíkulo.

🔟 Elogiá mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan pa nan esfuerso i dedikashon.

1️⃣1️⃣ Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke mira serka e mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan dor di e manera ku bo ta trata nan.

1️⃣2️⃣ Elogiá, respetá i reflehá riba e kontribushonnan di mamanan, tatanan i edukadónan
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

text: 🗓️ Dia 4 (p.e., Djaluna) — Rekordatorio di Práktika di Kas

SourceText: Encourage parents to practice their parenting tips at home by reminding them that the key to changing behaviours and attitudes is to practice them in their own lives.
text: Enkurashá mayornan pa praktiká nan tepnan di edukashon familiar na kas dor di kòrda nan ku e yabi pa kambia komportashon i aktitut ta pa praktiká nan den nan mes bida.
🗓️ Dia 5 (p.e., Djárason) — Djis nos ta 'Chat'

SourceText:
Remind parents about the session one day before the session takes place. Include any details they may need to attend the session, including time, date, group chat name and how to join the chat.

Give them an idea of what to expect by letting them know what topic you will be discussing in the coming week.

Make sure your message is positive and welcoming and that parents know you are looking forward to hearing from everyone!
text:
Kòrda mayornan riba e seshon un dia promé ku e seshon tuma lugá. Inkluí kualke detaye ku nan lo mester pa asistí na e seshon, inkluí ora, fecha, nòmber di e 'chat' di grupo i kon pa djòin e 'chat'.

Duna nan un idea di kiko por spera dor di laga nan sa ki tópiko lo bo trata den e siman benidero.

Sòru pa bo mensahe ta positivo i kaluroso i ku mayornan sa ku bo ta ansioso pa tende di nan tur!

SourceText: What to cover in the WhatsApp Call?
text: Kiko pa kubri den e Yamada di WhatsApp?

SourceText:
Thank the parent for volunteering to lead the WhatsApp group.  

While engaging with other parents in the group, keep the following in mind:

🔵 Greet parents when engaging with them.
🔵 Respect what participants share and be aware of different ages, genders, values and circumstances.
🔵 Encourage parents to share and respond to each other - and praise them for it.
🔵 Remind parents of ground rules when needed.
🔵 Model the behaviour you want to see among the parents.

If the parent needs any prompts for discussion, share the following:
text:
Gradisí e mayor pa boluntariamente dirigí e grupo di WhatsApp.  

Miéntras bo ta atendé ku otro mayornan den e grupo, tene lo siguiente na mente:

🔵 Saludá mayornan ora bo ta atendé ku nan.
🔵 Respetá loke e partisipantenan ta kompartí i ta konsiente di diferente edat, sekso, balor i sirkunstansia.
🔵 Enkurashá mayornan pa kompartí i kontestá otro - i elogiá nan pa esaki.
🔵 Kòrda mayornan riba e reglanan básiko ora ta nesesario.
🔵Duna ehèmpel di e komportashon ku bo ke mira serka e mayornan.

Si e mayor mester di kualke instrukshon pa diskushon, kompartí lo siguiente:

SourceText: Some more building blocks for one-on-one time
text: Algun komponente básiko mas pa Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu

SourceText:
- Use words to describe what your child is doing during One-on-One Time – it shows you are paying attention to them and helps build vocabulary for younger children,

- Allow your child to take the lead during One-on-One time.

- Allow your child to invite you into their world by showing interest in what they are doing.

- Accept and observe instead of asking questions and criticising your child when playing.

- Play at your child’s developmental level and pace.

- Find ways of playing together instead of competitive games during One-on-One time.
text:
- Usa palabra pa deskribí kiko bo yu ta hasi durante Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu – e ta demostrá ku bo tin atenshon pa nan i ta yuda konstruí vokabulario pa muchanan mas yòn,

- Permití bo yu tuma e liderazgo durante Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu.

- Permití bo yu invitá bo den su mundu dor di mustra interes den loke e ta hasi.

- Aseptá i opservá na lugá di hasi pregunta i kritiká bo yu ora e ta hunga.

- Hunga na e nivel i ritmo di desaroyo di bo yu.

- Buska maneranan di hunga huntu na lugá di weganan kompetitivo durante Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu.

SourceText: More One-on-One time building blocks for parents with adolescents
text: Mas komponentenan básiko di Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu pa mayornan ku yunan adolesente

SourceText:
- One-on-One time means giving your full attention to your teen.

- Allow your teen to talk to lead in a conversation or activity.

- Look at your teen while they are speaking.

- Show interest in their story and acceptance of their feelings.
text:
- Tempu pa Abo ku Bo Yu ta nifiká duna atenshon kompletu na bo yu tiner.

- Pèrmití bo yu pa papia i pa dirigí un kombersashon òf aktividat.

- Wak bo tiner miéntras e ta papia.

- Mustra interes den loke e ta konta i aseptashon di su sintimentunan.

SourceText: Key issues to be aware of
text: Asuntunan klave pa tene kuenta kuné

SourceText:
In this first module it’s important to create a welcoming space for everyone. 

Ground rules should be developed at the beginning of the programme and owned by the group – so everybody should agree. 
- Try to help parents make specific rules. 
- Make sure everybody in the group understands each rule and what is required of the group.
- Help parents to make positive rules! Instead of ‘no criticising’ try ‘provide supportive feedback’.
- Give parents a chance to debate the rules that are being suggested. This will help everyone to own the final set of rules. 
- Praise suggestions!

**Praise & confidence building**: Remember that just like speaking up in a group for the first time, parents might be feeling nervous. Give parents as much positive reinforcement and thanks for sharing as you can on day one. 

**Normalising difficult households**: Make sure you remind parents that no household is perfect! We all have problems and challenges – praise parents regularly for being here because they want to put in the work to change something for the better. 

**Confidentiality:** This means that what gets said or circulated in the group, stays in the group! It’s important to be clear right at the beginning what is okay to share with others outside the group and what is not. In order for people to feel comfortable enough to participate, they need to know that they can trust the group with the stories they are sharing – and that these will not be shared outside of the group. Sharing new positive information is absolutely fine, though! 

If there is a need to break confidentiality, it is because a parent has disclosed or has shown evidence or significant risk of harm to themselves or their children (physical, emotional, or physical). The facilitator needs to break confidentiality if there is a risk of self-harm or harm to others. When this happens, the facilitator will ensure that they communicate directly in private with the person in question.
text:
Den e promé módulo aki ta importante pa krea un espasio kaluroso pa tur hende.

Mester desaroyá reglanan básiko na kuminsamentu di e programa i esakinan ta pertenesé na e grupo – pues tur hende mester ta di akuerdo.
- Purba yuda mayornan traha reglanan spesífiko.
- Sòru pa tur hende den e grupo komprondé kada regla i kiko ta rekerí di e grupo.
- Yuda mayornan traha reglanan positivo! Na lugá ‘no kritiká’ purba ‘duna 'feedback' konstruktivo’.
- Duna mayornan chèns pa debatí riba e reglanan ku a sugerí. Esaki lo yuda tur hende pa ta doño di e sèt final di reglanan.
- Elogiá sugerensianan!

**Elogio & krea konfiansa**: Kòrda ku mayornan por ta sinti nan mes nervioso meskos ku abo ora ku bo mester a papia den un grupo pa promé biaha. Duna mayornan mas tantu afirmashon positivo posibel i yama danki pa kompartí mas tantu ku bo por riba e promé dia.

**Normalisá situashonnan difísil den kasnan**: Sòru pa bo kòrda mayornan ku ningun kas ta perfekto! Nos tur tin problema i retonan – elogiá mayornan regularmente pa ta partisipá aki pasó nan ke duna di nan parti pa kambia algu pa mihó.

**Konfidensialidat:** Esaki ta nifiká ku loke papia òf loke ta sirkulá den e grupo, ta keda den e grupo! Ta importante pa ta kla for di kuminsamentu kiko ta bon pa kompartí ku otronan pafó di e grupo i kiko nò. Pa hende por sinti nan mes sufisiente kómodo pa partisipá, nan mester sa ku nan por konfia e grupo ku e historianan ku nan ta kompartí – i ku lo no kompartí esakinan pafó di e grupo. Kompartí informashon positivo nobo sí ta hopi bon!

Si mester di kibra konfidensialidat, ta pasobra un mayor a divulgá òf a mustra evidensia òf riesgo signifikante di daño na su mes òf su yunan (físiko, emoshonal òf físiko). E fasilitadó mester kibra konfidensialidat si tin riesgo di daño propio òf daño na otronan. Ora esaki sosodé, e fasilitadó lo sòru pa e komuniká direktamente den privá ku e persona en kuestion.

SourceText: Talking about emotions can be new
text: Papia tokante emoshon por ta nobo

SourceText: It is completely normal for parents to have difficulty talking about and expressing emotions and feelings. Parents may be trying to recognise their own emotions and communicate about them for the first time here. Talking about feelings also has the benefit of bringing awareness to positive emotions such as happiness or calmness!
text: Ta kompletamente normal pa mayornan tin difikultat pa papia tokante i ekspresá emoshon i sintimentunan. Aki, mayornan por ta purba na rekonosé nan mes emoshonnan i komuniká tokante nan pa promé biaha. Papia tokante sintimentunan tambe tin e benefisio di trese konsientisashon di emoshonnan positivo manera felisidat òf trankilidat!
Emoshonnan i género

SourceText: Many people are taught not to cry when they are sad. This might be especially true for boys and men. It’s important to understand that boys and men have the same feelings as girls and women, and that sharing emotions does not need to reduce their sense of masculinity. Sharing emotions is a sign of courage and strength.
text: Hopi hende ta siña pa no yora ora nan ta tristu. Esaki por ta spesialmente bèrdat pa mucha hòmber i hende hòmber. Ta importante pa komprondé ku mucha hòmber i hende hòmber tin e mésun sintimentunan ku mucha muhé i hende muhé, i ku kompartí emoshonnan no mester redusí nan sentido di maskulinidat. Kompartí emoshon ta un señal di kurashi i forsa.
Aseptá emoshonnan negativo

SourceText: Negative emotions are just as normal as positive emotions! Some parents might feel disrespected when their children display negative emotions. This does not mean that parents are losing control or authority over their child. Parents should encourage children to be aware of their emotions by helping them to name emotions, and to talk about how they are experiencing their emotions as this will help them to regulate their emotions.
text: Emoshonnan negativo ta mésun normal ku emoshonnan positivo! Algun mayor por sinti ku nan yunan ta falta rèspèt ora nan ta mustra emoshonnan negativo. Esaki no ta nifiká ku mayornan ta pèrdiendo kòntròl òf outoridat riba nan yu. Mayornan mester enkurashá yunan pa ta konsiente di nan emoshonnan dor di yuda nan nombra emoshonnan, i pa papia tokante kon nan ta eksperensiá nan emoshonnan ya ku esaki lo yuda nan regulá nan emoshonnan.

SourceText: Keep focus on positive instead of negative behaviour
text: Keda enfoká riba komportashon positivo na lugá di esun negativo

SourceText: Parents usually only notice the times when children do not follow instructions and miss the times when they do. Parents need to know what behaviour they want to see from their children and start describing that when giving instructions.
text: Mayornan por lo general ta ripará solamente e momentunan ku e muchanan no ta sigui instrukshon i ta pèrdè e momentunan ku si nan ta hasié. Mayornan mester sa ki komportashon nan ke mira di nan yunan i kuminsá deskribí esei ora di duna instrukshon.

SourceText: Giving positive instructions can be challenging at first
text: Duna instrukshonnan positivo por ta un reto na kuminsamentu

SourceText: Learning how to give positive instructions can be challenging for parents at first. They are used to giving instructions in a negative way. Your job as a facilitator is to model how to give positive instructions. In this way, parents are encouraged to give clear, positive instructions.
text: Siña kon pa duna instrukshon positivo por ta un reto pa mayornan na kuminsamentu. Nan ta kustumá di duna instrukshon na un manera negativo. Bo trabou komo fasilitadó ta pa duna ehèmpel kon pa duna instrukshonnan positivo. Di e manera ei, bo ta animá mayornan pa duna instrukshonnan kla i positivo.
Sostené muchanan ku ta biba ku desabilidat

SourceText: Parents should support their children to be able to follow instructions by thinking about how to break them down into smaller pieces while still allowing their children the space to work independently. This will help children feel more confident while still being supported. They should also allow time and space for children to work things out before interfering.
text: Mayornan mester sostené nan yunan pa por sigui instrukshonnan dor di pensa kon pa parti e instrukshonnan den pidanan mas chikitu miéntras ku nan ta sigui duna nan yunan e espasio pa traha independientemente. Esaki lo yuda muchanan sinti mas sigur di nan mes miéntras ku nan ta haña sosten. Nan mester duna e muchanan tambe e tempu i espasio pa solushoná nan mes problemanan promé ku intervení.

SourceText: Praising can feel awkward at first
text: Elogiá por sinti straño na kuminsamentu

SourceText: Many parents don’t have experience of praise or positive attention themselves. They can feel embarrassed or awkward about praising their children. But praising becomes easier with practice – and it is rewarded by the response that children provide to being praised.
text: Hopi mayor mes no tin eksperensia di elogio òf atenshon positivo. Nan por sinti bèrgwensa òf sinti inkómodo pa elogiá nan yunan. Pero elogio ta bira mas fásil si bo praktiká – i e ta keda rekompensá a base di e reakshon ku e muchanan ta duna ora nan haña elogio.

SourceText: Involving everyone in the household in rules and routines
text: Enbolbí tur hende den kas den regla i rutinanan

SourceText:
While it’s important to involve the entire household in making household rules and routines, this can be difficult in some families where decisions are not made together. 

You can explore how discussing different ideas for rules and routines with members of the family can have a positive impact on everyone’s well-being. Children will feel respected and listened to and teens are more likely to follow rules if they have been involved in creating them.
text:
Ounke ku ta importante pa enbolbí henter e kas den trahamentu di reglanan i rutinanan di kas, esaki por ta difísil den algun famia kaminda no ta tuma desishonnan huntu.

Bo por eksplorá kon diskushon di diferente idea pa regla i rutina ku miembronan di famia por tin un impakto positivo riba bienestar di tur hende. E muchanan lo sinti nan mes respetá i skuchá i hóbennan tin mas chèns di sigui reglanan si a enbolbí nan den traha esakinan.

SourceText: The importance of sleep and bedtime routines
text: E importansia di rutinanan di soño i rutinanan promé ku bai drumi

SourceText:
Bedtime is one of the most important routines that parents can establish for their children. Children need enough sleep to grow and be healthy. A routine is a good way to help ensure that they get enough sleep. 

It’s also important to stress that parents, too, need to get enough sleep. Sleep deprivation affects everyone’s behaviour! Bedtime routines last about 30 minutes and can involve washing, establishing a quiet and calm environment, singing, or reading to your child and then providing an affectionate goodnight. 

Bedtime routines can even be helpful for teens. Less screen time and more relaxing activities help a teen get a good night of sleep. The same is true for parents and you!

Some families may live in crowded or stressful environments, or have irregular routines because of shift work or money worries. But even small, predictable bedtime moments can help children feel safe and secure.
text:
Ora di bai drumi ta un di e rutinanan mas importante ku mayornan por establesé pa nan yunan. Muchanan mester di sufisiente soño pa krese i ta salú. Un rutina ta un bon manera pa yuda garantisá ku nan ta haña sufisiente soño.

Tambe ta importante pa enfatisá ku mayornan tambe mester drumi sufisiente. Falta di soño ta afektá komportashon di tur hende! Rutinanan di bai drumi ta dura mas o ménos 30 minüt i por enserá baña, establesé un ambiente ketu i trankil, kanta òf lesa pa bo yu i despues yama bonochi na un manera kariñoso.

Rutinanan promé ku bai drumi por ta útil asta pa hóbennan. Ménos tempu riba pantaya i mas aktividat relahante ta yuda un hóben drumi bon anochi. Meskos ta konta pa mayornan i pa abo!

Algun famia por ta biba den ambientenan ku hopi hende òf ku ta kousa strès, òf tin rutinanan iregular pa motibu di traha warda òf preokupashonnan di plaka. Pero asta momentunan chikí i predisibel promé ku bai drumi por yuda muchanan sinti nan mes seif i sigur.
Género

SourceText: In some families the rules for boys and girls are different. This is often because of expectations or traditional norms relating to the different roles that boys and girls can play. This is something that could be explored further to see if the different rules are really necessary or are limiting boys or girls. Parents may need support thinking about how this may affect their children.
text: Den algun famia e reglanan pa mucha hòmber i mucha muhé ta diferente. Hopi bia esaki ta pa motibu di ekspektativanan òf normanan tradishonal relashoná ku e diferente ròlnan ku mucha hòmber i mucha muhé por hunga. Esaki ta algu ku por eksplorá mas leu pa wak si e diferente reglanan realmente ta nesesario òf ta limitando e mucha hòmber of e mucha muhé. Mayornan lo mester di sosten pa pensa riba kon esaki por afektá nan yunan.

SourceText: Try to avoid misbehaviour in the first place
text: Purba di evitá mal komportashon na promé lugá

SourceText: Parents should try to avoid misbehaviour in the first place. By redirecting a child’s attention away from a problem behaviour towards a positive behaviour, parents can avoid needing to discipline their child. Parents should use redirect before the negative behaviour gets worse by giving a clear and positive instruction towards another activity. In this way they ignore the misbehaviour
text: Mayornan mester purba di evitá mal komportashon na promé lugá. Dor di desviá e atenshon di un mucha for di un komportashon problemátiko pa un komportashon positivo, mayornan por evitá ku mester disipliná nan yu. Mayornan mester desviá e atenshon promé ku e komportashon negativo bira pió dor di duna un instrukshon kla i positivo pa hasi un otro aktividat. Di e forma akí nan ta ignorá e komportashon malu
Konsekuensianan no ta straf

SourceText: It is more helpful for parents to think of consequences as opportunities to teach their children that their actions have an impact both on themselves and on others. This, in turn, helps children to learn about responsibility and decision-making.
text: Ta mas útil pa mayornan pensa riba konsekuensianan komo oportunidatnan pa siña nan yunan ku nan akshonnan tin un impakto tantu riba nan mes komo riba otronan. Esaki, na su turno, ta yuda muchanan siña tokante responsabilidat i tuma desishon.
Kòrda: No tin mucha 'mala muchal'…

SourceText: … Just ‘bad’ behaviours! Parents should try to keep their focus on their children’s behaviour. This will help them to remember that children need as much love and nurturing as they can provide.
text: … Djis 'mal' komportashon! Mayornan mester purba di tene nan enfoke riba e komportashon di nan yunan. Esaki lo yuda nan kòrda ku mucha mester di asina tantu amor i atenshon ku nan por duna.
E sentimentu di tristesa di e último módulo

SourceText: The last module of the programme can be emotionally challenging for parents, who may have developed relationships with each other. Many parents will also have come to depend on the support that they get from each other – especially for those who have a lot of challenges at home. It’s important to stress to parents that they can continue to support each other after the programme ends, and with someone taking over the administration of the chat, they can continue to go to the same space and meet the same people for that support.
text: E último módulo di e programa por ta un reto emoshonal pa mayornan, ku por a desaroyá relashonnan ku otro. Hopi mayor tambe lo a bin ta dependé di e sosten ku nan ta haña di otro – spesialmente pa esnan ku tin hopi reto na kas. Ta importante pa enfatisá serka mayornan ku nan por sigui sostené otro despues ku e programa kaba i ku si un hende tuma riba su mes e atministrashon di e 'chat', nan por kontinuá riba e mésun espasio di 'chat' aki i topa e mésun hendenan pa e sosten ei.
Prepará pa sertifikado

SourceText:
1️⃣ **Review reports**: Take a quick look at your group’s reports and make sure you have filled the attendance accurately. This helps make sure no parent misses out. 

2️⃣ **Reach out to your supervisor**: Let your supervisor know the program has finished and that parents in your group are ready for certificates. This gives them a heads-up to prepare the files for you.

3️⃣ **Receive certificates from your supervisor**: Your supervisor will generate the certificates for all eligible parents. Coordinate with your supervisors to receive the copies of the certificates.

For an in-person closing session, you can print the certificates. 

For an online closing session, you can send the certificates as image via WhatsApp.
text:
1️⃣ **Repasá rapòrtnan**: Tira un bista rápido riba e rapòrtnan di bo grupo i sòru pa bo a yena e asistensia korektamente. Esaki ta yuda sigurá ku ningun mayor no ta kai afó.

2️⃣ **Tuma kontakto ku bo supervisor**: Laga bo supervisor sa ku e programa a kaba i ku mayornan den bo grupo ta kla pa sertifikado. Esaki ta dun'é un chèns pa prepará e failnan pa bo.

3️⃣ **Risibí sertifikado di bo supervisor**: Bo supervisor lo generá e sertifikadonan pa tur mayor ku ta bini na remarke. Kordiná ku bo supervisornan pa risibí e kopianan di e sertifikadonan.

Pa un seshon di klousura en persona, bo por imprimí e sertifikadonan.

Pa un seshon di klousura 'online', bo por manda e sertifikadonan komo imágen via WhatsApp.

SourceText:
Welcome to the @global.prog_name programme!

Thank you for your commitment and dedication to supporting children and families in your community.

@global.prog_name is a group-based family strengthening programme for families with children and teens ages 2 to 17. 

It has been designed specifically with the goal of promoting positive parent-child relationships to reduce the risk of physical and emotional child abuse and neglect in the communities.
text:
Bon Bini na e programa @global.prog_name!

Danki pa bo kompromiso i dedikashon pa sostené muchanan i famianan den bo komunidat.

@global.prog_name ta un programa pa fortalesé famia, basá riba grupo, pa famianan ku yu i hóbennan di edat 2 pa 17.

A diseña esaki spesífikamente ku e meta di promové relashonnan positivo entre mayor i yu pa redusí e riesgo di abusu i negligensia físiko i emoshonal di mucha den komunidat.

SourceText:
The @global.app_name is your digital companion for delivering the @global.prog_name programme with confidence. 

It is designed to support you as a facilitator, offering practical tools, guidance, and ready-to-use resources so you can focus on what matters most - building positive connections with parents.
text:
E @global.app_name ta bo kompañero digital pa fasilitá e programa @global.prog_name ku konfiansa.

E ta diseñá pa sostené abo komo fasilitadó, dor di ofresé hèrmèntnan práktiko, guia i rekursonan kla pa usa pa bo por enfoká riba loke ta mas importante - krea konekshonnan positivo ku mayornan.

SourceText:
**With this app, you can**:
- 📘 Access step-by-step instructions for delivering each module.
- 💬 Find guidance on introducing caregivers to the programme and providing ongoing support.
- 📂 Explore detailed content, structure, and delivery plans for the programme.
- ▶️ Use practical tools such as pre-drafted messages, audios, and videos to share with parent groups.
- 👥 Manage parent groups with ease -  add and update parent information, track attendance, and generate reports.
text:
**Ku e aplikashon akí, bo por**:
- 📘Haña akseso na instrukshonnan paso pa paso pa por fasilitá kada módulo.
- 💬Haña guia pa introdusí edukadónan na e programa i duna sosten kontinuo.
- 📂Eksplorá kontenido detayá, struktura i plannan di fasilitashon pa e programa.
- ▶️Usa hèrmèntnan práktiko manera mensahenan, oudio i vidionan trahá di antemano pa kompartí ku gruponan di mayor.
- 👥Manehá gruponan di mayor ku fasilidat - agregá i aktualisá informashon di mayor, sigui partisipashon i generá rapòrtnan.

Ministerio di Desaroyo Sosial, Labor, i Bienestar, UNICEF Hulanda, Parenting for Lifelong Health, den kolaborashon ku Komishon Edukashon Familiar di Kòrsou a desaroyá @global.prog_name.

Basá riba e programa original di Jenny Doubt, Jamie M. Lachman, Sussie Mjwara, Marija Raleva i Jennel Reyes, ku Yuanling Chen i Stephanie Eagling-Peche, lisensiá bou di CC BY-SA 4.0.

Adaptá pa Judiska Cijntje, Peggy Grootens-Tecla, Yanieck Abdoelrahman - de Wolff, Ytske van Winden, Ana Pro, Deepali Barapatre, Jenny Doubt, i Jamie M. Lachman bou di e mésun lisensia.

@global.prog_name ta parti di un inisiativa mas grandi yamá Parenting for Lifelong Health (PLH).

SourceText:
The overall goal of @global.prog_name is to provide parents with the skills to promote healthy child development, learning, and wellbeing. We achieve this goal by improving the following: 

- **Parent sense of responsibility and commitment**: Recognise and embrace their essential role in raising children.

- **Parenting knowledge, skill, and sense of competence**: Gaining practical skills and confidence in parenting

- **Parent knowledge in child development**: Understanding key stages of child development and age-appropriate needs.

- **Positive parenting behaviour**: Encouraging nurturing, respectful, and supportive interactions.

- **Positive, consistent discipline strategies**: Using calm, constructive, and consistent discipline.

- **Parental supervision of children**: Ensuring safe, attentive, and appropriate supervision.

- **Child behaviour and wellbeing**: Promoting healthy emotional and social development.

- **Caregiver mental health and social support**: Enhancing wellbeing through community support and self-care.
text:
E meta general di @global.prog_name ta pa duna mayornan abilidatnan pa promové desaroyo salú, siñamentu i bienestar di mucha. Nos ta logra e meta akí dor di mehorá lo siguiente:

- **Sentido di responsabilidat i kompromiso di mayor**: Rekonosé i brasa nan ròl esensial den edukashon di yu.

- **Konosementu di edukashon familiar, abilidat i sentido di ta kompetente **: Haña abilidatnan práktiko i konfiansa den edukashon familiar

- **Konosementu di mayor den desaroyo di mucha**: Komprondementu di fasenan klave di desaroyo di mucha i nesesidatnan apropiá pa kada edat.

- **Komportashon positivo di edukashon familiar**: Enkurashá interakshonnan di kuido, respetuoso i di sosten.

- **Strategianan di disiplina positivo i konsistente**: Usa disiplina trankil, konstruktivo i konsistente.

- **Supervishon di mayornan riba yunan**: Garantisá supervishon seif, atento i apropiá.

- **Komportashon di mucha i bienestar **: Promové desaroyo emoshonal i sosial saludabel.

- **Salú mental i sosten sosial di e edukadó**: Mehorá bienestar pa medio di sosten di komunidat i kuido propio.
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
As a facilitator, your role is to guide small groups of caregivers (usually 12–15 people) through the programme.

The @global.prog_name is designed to be flexible so that you can deliver it in a way that best fits your parent group.

The programme is delivered mainly through a **WhatsApp group**. You will set up and manage the group, share the curriculum with caregivers, and lead group discussions.

When you create a parent group in the app, you will choose the age group focus: Caregivers of young children (2-9), Caregivers of teens (10-17), Caregivers of young children and teens (2-17)

The programme has **six sessions**. These can be a mix of in-person and remote (WhatsApp-based) sessions.

You and your organisation can decide which format is best for your group:

- **Onboarding only (Session 1 in person)**: Meet parents face-to-face to build trust, explain how the programme works, and practice the first skills together.

- **Closing only (Session 6 in person)**: Meet parents face-to-face at the end to reflect, celebrate progress, and encourage continued practice.
- **Both onboarding and closing (Sessions 1 & 6 in person)**: Start strong with group connection and finish with a meaningful celebration.
- **Fully remote (all sessions on WhatsApp)**: Run everything online if in-person meetings are not possible.
The core of the programme always happens in the WhatsApp group, whether or not you have in-person sessions.
text:
Komo fasilitadó, bo ròl ta pa guia gruponan chikí di edukadónan (normalmente 12–15 persona) durante di e programa.

E @global.prog_name ta diseñá pa ta flèksibel, pa bo por dun'é na un manera ku ta kuadra mihó ku bo grupo di mayor.
Ta fasilitá e programa prinsipalmente via di un **grupo di WhatsApp**. Lo bo forma i manehá e grupo, kompartí e kuríkulo ku e edukadónan, i dirigí diskushonnan di grupo.
Ora bo krea un grupo di mayor den e aplikashon, lo bo skohe e grupo di edat: Edukadónan di mucha chikí (2-9), edukadónan di hóben (10-17), edukadónan di mucha chikí i hóben (2-17)

E programa tin **seis seshon**. Esakinan por ta un meskla di seshonnan en persona i remoto (basá riba WhatsApp).

Abo i bo organisashon por disidí kua formato ta mihó pa bo grupo:

- **Seshon di Introdukshon so (Seshon 1 en persona)**: Topa mayornan kara-kara pa krea konfiansa, splika kon e programa ta funshoná i praktiká e promé abilidatnan huntu.

- **Klousura so (Seshon 6 en persona)**: Topa mayornan kara-kara na final pa reflehá, selebrá progreso, i enkurashá pa kontinuá ku práktika.
- **Tantu introdukshon komo klousura (Seshonnan 1 & 6 en persona)**: Kuminsá fuerte ku konekshon di grupo i finalisá ku un selebrashon signifikante.
- **Kompletamente remoto (tur seshon riba WhatsApp)**: Hasi tur kos "online", si reunionnan en persona no ta posibel.
E parti prinsipal di e programa semper ta sosodé den e grupo di WhatsApp, sea bo tin seshonnan en persona òf nò.
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
**Remote Session Routine (WhatsApp-Based)**

Sessions 2–5 are always run online using a **weekly schedule**:

**Day One** - Learn with a Story: Share lesson content (short pre-recorded videos with parenting story, parenting tips, and a home activity for parents to try).

**Day Four** - Home Practice Reminder: Send a reminder to parents to practice the home activity.

**Day Five** - Chat coming soon: Send a reminder about the group chat the next day.

**Day Six** - Let’s connect: Host a live group chat (about 1 hour). Each live chat has a similar flow: check-in and discussion on home activity challenges
This schedule helps parents know what to expect and makes it easier for them to participate.
text:
**Rutina di Seshon Riba Distansia (Basá riba WhatsApp)**

Semper ta ehekutá seshonnan 2–5 'online' usando un **programa semanal**:

**Dia Un** - Siña ku un Historia: Kompartí kontenido di lès (vidionan kòrtiku pre-grabá ku historia di mayor, tepnan pa mayor tokante di edukashon familiar i un tarea pa mayornan purba hasi na kas).

**Dia Kuater** - Rekordatorio pa hasi tarea di kas: Manda un rekordatorio pa mayornan pa hasi e tarea di kas.

**Dia Sinku** - Pronto ta 'Chat': Manda un rekordatorio tokante e 'chat' di grupo pa e siguiente dia.

**Dia Seis** - Ban konektá: Guia en bibu, un 'chat' den grupo (mas o ménos 1 ora). Kada 'chat' en bibu tin un fluho similar: kuminsá ku un 'chèk-in' i diskutí riba retonan di e tarea di kas
E skema akí ta yuda mayornan pa sa kiko por spera i ta hasié mas fásil pa nan partisipá.

SourceText:
The core programme focuses on one module each week over six weeks. 
The core modules are presented in this order: 

Module 1 – Introduction and spending one-on-one time with your child

Module 2 – Talking about feelings

Module 3 – Keeping it Positive: Giving instructions & delivering praise

Module 4 – Keeping your child safe with household rules & routines

Module 5 – Positive discipline: Using redirect and consequences

Module 6 – Problem-solving with children & final reflection
text:
E programa prinsipal ta enfoká riba un módulo kada siman durante seis siman.
Ta presentá e módulonan prinsipal den e sekuensia akí:

Módulo 1 – Introdukshon i tempu pa abo ku bo yu

Módulo 2 – Papia riba emoshon

Módulo 3 – Keda positivo: Duna instrukshon & duna elogio

Módulo 4 – Mantené bo yu seif ku reglanan di kas i rutinanan diario

Módulo 5 – Disiplina positivo: Usa método di desviá i konsekuensianan

Módulo 6 – Resolvé problema huntu ku mucha i reflekshon final

SourceText:
