Ground rules make your WhatsApp Support Group a safe space for everyone. 

If someone forgets the ground rules, send the message below to gently remind them of their importance. 

If necessary, share a group reminder about the importance of maintaining a positive and respectful space. 

If, despite reminders, the parent continues not to follow the rules, notify your supervisor. 

You can remove the parent from the group as the last option, done only when you feel it is necessary. For example, if a member repeatedly shares unrelated content, uses inappropriate language or is disrespectful to another member. 

If you do remove someone from the group, it should be handled with sensitivity and respect. Make sure you talk privately with the parent, remind the group about ground rules, and notify your supervisor.
text:

Si un hende lubidá e reglanan básilko, manda e mensahe akí bou pa kòrd'é di un forma amabel riba nan importansia. 

Si ta nesesario, kompartí un rekordatorio di grupo tokante e importansia di mantené un espasio positivo i respetuoso. 

Si, apesar di rekordatorionan, e mayor tòg, no ta sigui e reglanan, notifiká bo supervisor. 

Bo por saka e mayor for di e grupo komo e último opshon, hasi esaki solamente si bo ta sinti ku esei ta nesesario. Por ehèmpel, si un miembro kada bes ta kompartí kontenido no relevante, ta usa idioma inapropiá òf ta falta rèspèt na un otro miembro.

SourceText:
Getting everyone to join in the chat sessions can be a bit challenging. Some parents might be busy, shy, or just prefer to read about other’s experiences. 

Here are some helpful tips to encourage participation: 

1. Directly ask a question to someone by typing @parent name on WhatsApp. 

2. Share one of the messages below with the entire group. 

3. Consider sending a private message to a parent (see the message below).
text:
Haña tur hende pa djòin e seshonnan di kòmbersashon por ta un tiki difísil. Algun mayor por ta okupá, tímido òf ta preferá di djis lesa tokante eksperenshanan di otro hende. 

Aki tin algun tep útil pa enkurashá partisipashon: 

1. Hasi un pregunta direktamente na un hende dor di skibi @nòmber di mayor riba WhatsApp. 

2. Kompartí un di e mensahenan akí bou ku henter e grupo. 

3. Konsiderá manda un mensahe privá pa un mayor (wak e mensahe akí bou).
note: The string @parent should not be translated.

SourceText:
Engaging parents in the group chat can sometimes be hard. Some parents may need a nudge to share their experiences or they might be busy with their schedules. 

If your chat goes silent after the prompt, consider sharing these ideas or suggestions:
text:
Tin bia por ta difísil pa enbolbí mayornan den e kòmbersashon di grupo. Algun mayor lo por tin mester di un èkstra motivashon pa kompartí nan eksperenshanan òf kisas nan tin un skema okupá. 

Si bo 'chat' keda ketu despues di e instrukshon, konsiderá kompartí e ideanan òf sugerenshanan akí:

SourceText:
Your parent has missed the last 2 consecutive chat sessions for the **first time**. Send a short, friendly message to remind them and invite them back.

Please click on “I followed up” once you have sent the message.
text:
Bo mayor a pèrdè e último 2 seshonnan di 'chat' konsekutivo pa **promé biaha**. Manda un mensahe kòrtiku i amistoso pa rekord'é i invit'é pa e bolbe.

Por fabor klek riba “Mi a chèk” unabes ku bo a manda e mensahe.

SourceText:
Parents who have missed the last 2 consecutive chat sessions will appear in your list.
You will follow up with each parent up to 3 times.
After the third follow-up, if the parent still does not rejoin, they will no longer appear in your list.
text:
Mayornan ku a pèrdè e último 2 seshonnan di 'chat' konsekutivo lo aparesé den bo lista.
Bo ta chèk ku kada mayor te ku 3 biaha.
Despues di e di tres chèk, si e mayor no bolbe, e lo no aparesé mas riba bo lista.

SourceText:
Your parent has missed the last 2 consecutive chat sessions for the **second time**. Give them a call to check in and encourage them to return.

Use the call to:
Ask how they and their child are doing.
Find out why they missed the last sessions.
Discuss any challenges and help find solutions using A–E–C–P (Accept, Connect, Explore, Practice).
Ask about the last home activity they tried.
Share a short summary of what was covered in the missed sessions.
Encourage them to join the next session.
Thank them for their time.

Please click on “I followed up” once you have sent the message.
text:
Bo mayor a pèrdè e último 2 seshonnan di 'chat' konsekutivo pa **di dos biaha**. Yama nan pa 'chèk-in' i enkurashá nan pa bolbe.

Usa e yamada pa:
Puntra kon ta ku nan i nan yu.
Saka afó dikon nan a pèrdè e último seshonnan.
Diskutí kualke reto i yuda haña solushonnan usando A–E–K–P (Aseptá, Konektá, Eksplorá, Praktiká).
Puntra tokante e último aktividat na kas ku nan a purba.
Kompartí un resúmen kòrtiku di loke a kubri den e seshonnan ku nan a falta.
Enkurashá nan pa djòin e siguiente seshon.
Yama nan danki pa nan tempu.

Por fabor klek riba “Mi a chèk” unabes ku bo a manda e mensahe.

SourceText:
Parents who have missed the last 2 consecutive chat sessions will appear in your list.
You will follow up with each parent up to 3 times.
This is the third follow-up. If the parent still does not rejoin, they will no longer appear in your list.
text:
Mayornan ku a pèrdè e último 2 seshonnan di 'chat' konsekutivo lo aparesé den bo lista.
Bo ta chèk ku kada mayor te ku 3 biaha.
Esaki ta e di e di tres chèk. Si e mayor no bolbe, e lo no aparesé mas riba bo lista.

SourceText:
Hey there! 👋 Just checking in with a friendly reminder to try this week’s home activity:

Spend a few minutes of One-on-One Time with your child –no distractions, just the two of you!

Here’s something to keep in mind:
Even short moments of focused attention help your child feel truly seen and loved. It strengthens your bond and reminds them that what they do is important. 💖

You’re doing great! Keep it up!
text:
Hei! 👋 Djis un rekordatorio amistoso pa purba e tarea pa hasi na kas di e siman akí:

Pasa algun minüt di Tempu pa abo ku bo yu—sin distraishon, djis boso dos!

Aki tin algu pa tene kuenta kuné:
Asta momentunan kòrtiku di atenshon dirigí solamente riba bo yu, ta yuda bo yu sintié di bèrdat mirá i stimá. E ta fortalesé boso relashon i ta kòrd'é ku loke e ta hasi ta importante. 💖

Bo ta hasié hopi bon! Sigui asina!i

SourceText: Hello! I look forward to hearing how the rest of your week goes when we next meet on [ENTER DATE HERE]. Chat then!
text: Kon ta bai! Mi ta spera di tende kon e sobrá di bo siman a bai ora nos topa otro riba [ENTER DATE HERE]. Nos lo 'chat' e ora ei!

SourceText: Hello and thanks for being part of the @global.prog_name chat! I am thrilled to be able to chat together about how we can best support our children to grow up healthy and happy. Today, we are going to chat about spending One-on-One time with your children.
text: Kon ta bai? Danki di ta forma parti di e 'chat' @global.prog_name! Mi ta entusiasmá pa kòmbersá huntu tokante kon nos por sostené nos yunan mihó pa krese salú i felis. Awe, nos ta ban 'chat' riba pasa Tempu Abo ku Bo Yunan.
note: The string @global.prog_name should not be translated.

SourceText:
Thanks so much for sharing! To make this a safe space to communicate openly let’s make some ground rules for this chat group. Our first rule is that what is said in the group stays in the group. You need to know that this group is private.
Here are some other examples to start us off:
📱 Let me know if you need to miss a chat session.
🩵 Accept each other. Everyone is different and has different experiences.
💬 Share only what you feel comfortable sharing.
❓ Feel free to ask questions!
🔏 Respect the privacy of personal pictures and videos that are sent to the chat group. 

Does anyone have any additional rules that they want to suggest?
text:
Mashá danki pa kompartí! Pa hasi esaki un espasio seif pa komuniká habrí, laga nos traha algun regla básiko pa e grupo di 'chat' akí. Nos promé regla ta, ku loke nos papia den e grupo ta keda den e grupo. Ta bon pa bo sa, ku e grupo aki ta privá.
Aki ta sigui algun otro ehèmpel pa nos kuminsá:
📱 Laga mi sa, si bo lo no por tei na un seshon di 'chat'. 
🩵 Aseptá otro.Tur hende ta diferente i tin diferente eksperensha.
💬 Kompartí solamente loke bo ta sintí bo kómodo pa kompartí.
❓ Sintí bo liber pa hasi pregunta!
🔏 Respetá e privasidat di potrèt i vidionan personal ku nos ta manda den e grupo di 'chat'. 

Tin hende ku kier sugerí kualke regla adishonal?

SourceText: Allow a couple minutes for parents to share. Praise suggestions and contributions. Make sure that everyone agrees on the ground rules.
text: Permití un par di minüt pa mayornan kompartí. Elogiá sugerenshanan i kontribushonnan. Sòru pa tur hende ta di akuerdo ku e reglanan básiko.

SourceText: Hello and thanks for being part of the@global.prog_name chat! I am thrilled to be able to chat together about how we can best support our children to grow up healthy and happy. Today, we are going to chat about spending One-on-One time with your children.
text: Kon ta bai i danki pa forma parti di e 'chat' di@global.prog_name! Mi ta entusiasmá di por 'chat' huntu tokante kon sostené nos yunan mihó pa nan krese salú i felis. Awe, nos ta bai 'chat' tokante pasa tempu abo ku bo yunan.
note: The string the@global.prog_name should not be translated.

text: Mensahe 2: Introdukshonnan

SourceText: Let’s introduce ourselves! Please share your name and your goal for the programme. As an example, my name is [INSERT NAME] and I want to learn more about how to help my child go to bed by 8 every night. Feel free to add your own to the chat using text or audio message.
text: Ban introdusí nos mes! Por fabor kompartí bo nòmber i bo meta pa e programa. Komo ehèmpel, mi nòmber ta [INSERT NAME] i mi ke siña mas tokante kon pa yuda mi yu bai drumi 8 or' tur anochi. Sintí bo liber pa jòin e 'chat' dor di usa mensahe di teksto òf oudio.

SourceText: Allow some time for parents to share.  Remember to praise each response. For example, you can say “Thanks for the response, [Insert Name]!” or “Great goal, [Insert Name]!”
text: Permití tempu pa mayornan kompartí. Kòrda elogiá kada kontesta. Por ehèmpel, bo por bisa “Danki pa e kontesta, [Insertá Nòmber]!” òf “Bon meta, [Insertá Nòmber]!”
Mensahe 3: Reglanan básiko

SourceText: Thanks so much for sharing! To make this a safe space to communicate openly let’s look at the ground rules for this chat group again.
text: Masha danki pa kompartí! Pa hasi esaki un espasio seif pa komuniká habrí laga nos wak e reglanan básiko pa e grupo di 'chat' aki atrobe.

text: Mensahe 4: Revisá tarea pa hasi na kas

SourceText:
Have you had a chance to try spending One-on-One Time with your child?
If you did, give me a thumbs up! 👍🏽
text:
Bo a haña chèns di purba pasa Tempu Abo ku Bo Yu?
Si bo a hasié, manda un dùim ariba pa mi! 👍🏽

SourceText: Message 5: Voting on a challenge to discuss
text: Mensahe 5: Vota riba un reto pa diskutí

SourceText:
If you gave a thumbs up — amazing! 🎉If you face some challenges during one-on-one time, that's completely normal. You’re not alone! Here are some common challenges caregivers have experienced. Vote for the one you’d like us to talk about together:

1️⃣ I didn’t have enough time
2️⃣ My child did not want to spend time with me
3️⃣ All my child wanted to do was watch TV or play with a gadget
4️⃣ My child wanted to do things I felt uncomfortable about
text:
Si bo a manda un dùim ariba — master! 🎉Si bo ta enfrentá algun reto durante tempu pa abo ku bo yu, esei ta kompletamente normal. Bo no ta bo so! Akí tin algun reto komun ku edukadónan a eksperensiá. Vota pa esun ku bo ke pa nos papia riba dje huntu:

1️⃣ Mi no tabatin sufisiente tempu
2️⃣ Mi yu no tabata ke pasa tempu ku mi
3️⃣ Tur loke mi yu kier a hasi tabata wak televishon òf hunga ku un "gadget"
4️⃣ Mi yu tabata ke hasi kosnan ku mi tabata sinti mi inkómodo ku nan
Mensahe 6: Diskutí riba solushon

SourceText: Choose the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible solutions to the challenges.
text: Skohe e reto ku mas voto. Enkurashá mayornan pa traha huntu pa identifiká solushonnan positivo. Akí tin algun posibel solushon pa e retonan.
Mensahe 7: Habri Komentario

SourceText: Thanks for discussing that challenge with me! Does anyone have any other challenges you’d like us to troubleshoot together? Feel free to share — we’re here to support each other!
text: Danki pa papia tokante e reto ei ku mi! Tin hende ku tin otro retonan pa nos solushoná huntu? Sintí bo liber pa kompartí — nos tei pa sostené otro!
Mensahe 8: Tuma un Pousa

SourceText: Before we end today’s session let’s take a pause together. This is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or overwhelmed. I really appreciate everyone’s contribution today. I’ll be in touch throughout the week with reminders about what’s coming next. Until then, have a peaceful and happy day!
text: Promé ku nos terminá e seshon di awe ban tuma un pousa huntu. Esaki ta algu ku bo por hasi semper ku bo ta sinti bo mes di strès of ku muchu kos na bo kabes. Mi ta apresiá tur hende su kontribushon di awe mashá. Lo mi ta den kontakto henter siman ku rekordatorionan tokante kiko ta sigui. Mientrastantu, pasa un dia trankil i felis!

SourceText: 👋 Hey there! It’s time for another parenting story. Today’s story is about helping your children to manage their feelings.
text: 👋 Hei! Ta tempu pa un otro historia di edukashon familiar. E historia di awe ta tokante yuda bo yunan manehá nan emoshonnan.

SourceText: Let’s see a story of parents talking about a difficult emotion with their teen.
text: Laga nos wak un historia di mayornan ku ta papia riba un emoshon difísil ku nan tiner.

SourceText: 💡Here are 5 things about how to talk about emotions with your children & your home activity for the week.
text: 💡Aki tin 5 punto tokante kon pa papia riba emoshon ku bo yunan & bo tarea pa hasi na kas pa e siman.

SourceText:
Hello! Remember this week’s home practice is to try to talk about emotions with your children during one-on-one time and other times during the week. 

Talking about emotions helps children learn that all feelings are okay—even the big or tricky ones. This makes it easier for them to understand themselves and talk to you about what they’re going through. 😊💬
text:
Kon ta bai! Kòrda ku e tarea pa hasi na kas di e siman aki ta pa purba papia riba emoshonnan ku bo yunan durante tempu huntu i durante otro momentunan di siman. 

Papia tokante emoshonnan ta yuda muchanan siña ku tur sintimentu ta bon—asta esnan fuerte òf difísil. Esaki ta hasié mas fásil pa nan komprondé nan mes i papia ku bo tokante loke nan ta pasa aden. 😊💬

SourceText: Can you believe that a whole week has gone by? Our next chat session will be later at [INSERT DATE & TIME]. We will continue learning about the benefits of talking about emotions with our children. Chat soon!
text: Bo por kere ku henter un siman a pasa? Nos siguiente seshon di 'chat' lo ta un djis aki riba [INSERT DATE & TIME]. Nos lo sigui siña tokante e benefisionan di papia riba emoshonnan ku nos yunan. Nos lo 'chat' pronto!

SourceText: Welcome to Module 2 of @global.prog_name! How is everybody doing? Happy? Stressed? Angry? Annoyed? Peaceful? Whatever emotion you feel…it’s okay! Please feel free to share how you are feeling today.
text: Bon Biní na Módulo 2 di @global.prog_name! Kon ta bai ku tur hende? Kontentu? Di strès? Rabiá? Fadá? Trankil? Kualke emoshon ku bo sinti…ta bon! Por fabor sintí bo liber pa kompartí kon bo ta sinti awe.
note: The string @global.prog_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Allow time for parents to share how they are feeling. You should also share how you are feeling. For example, “I am happy to be part of the chat today.”
text: Permití tempu pa mayornan kompartí kon nan ta sinti. Bo tambe mester kompartí kon bo ta sinti. Por ehèmpel, “Mi ta kontentu di ta parti di e 'chat' awe.”

SourceText:
Last time, we focused on helping children talk about their feelings.
If you found a moment to talk about emotions, whether during one-on-one time or another time in the week, give me a thumbs up! 👍🏽
text:
Biaha pasá, nos a enfoká riba yuda muchanan papia tokante nan sintimentunan.
Si bo a haña un momentu pa papia tokante emoshonnan, sea ta durante Tempu Pa Abo ku Bo Yu òf un otro momentu den siman, manda un dùim ariba! 👍🏽

SourceText:
Great job if you were able to give it a try! 🙌🏾 If starting conversations about emotions felt a bit tough, that’s totally understandable. Many parents and caregivers go through the same thing. Take a look at the challenges below and choose the one you’d like us to explore together:

1️⃣ My child did not want to share their feelings 
2️⃣ I felt uncomfortable talking about my feelings
3️⃣ I was afraid my child might think I am weak for sharing my own emotions
4️⃣ I was too stressed or angry to share my emotions, I prefer to be alone when I feel like that.
text:
Bon trabou si bo a logra purba! 🙌 Si bo a sinti un tiki difísil pa kuminsá kombersashonnan tokante emoshonnan, esei ta di komprondé kompletamente. Hopi mayor i edukadó ta pasa den e mésun kos. Tira un bista riba e retonan akí bou i skohe esun ku bo ke pa nos papia riba dje huntu:

1️⃣ Mi yu no tabata ke kompartí su emoshonnan 
2️⃣ Mi a sintí mi inkómodo pa papia tokante mi emoshonnan
3️⃣ Mi tabatin miedu ku mi yu lo pensa ku mi ta débil komo ku mi ta kompartí mi propio emoshonnan
4️⃣Mi tabata muchu di strès òf rabiá pa kompartí mi emoshonnan, mi ta preferá di ta mi so ora mi ta sinti asina.

SourceText: Replace [name challenge] with the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible solutions to the challenges.
text: Remplasá [nòmber di reto] ku e reto ku a haña mas voto. Enkurashá mayornan pa traha huntu pa identifiká solushonnan positivo. Akí tin algun posibel solushon pa e retonan.

SourceText: I appreciate you opening up about that! Are there any other challenging moments you’ve run into? You’re welcome to bring them up, this is a space where we can help each other out.
text: Mi ta apresiá ku bo ta habrí tokante esei! Tin otro momentunan difísil ku bo a topa? Bo ta bonbiní pa trese nan dilanti, esaki ta un espasio kaminda nos por yuda otro.

SourceText:
Before we end today’s chat session, let's take a pause together. Remember that this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed, or your children are annoying you. 

Thank you. The work you have done today is hard work – but it’s also very valuable work. It will help you to manage your own stress and give your children the tools they need to manage theirs. Have a peaceful and happy day!
text:
Promé ku nos terminá e seshon di 'chat' di awe, laga nos tuma un pousa huntu. Kòrda ku esaki ta algu ku bo por hasi semper ku bo ta sintí bo di strès òf bo yunan ta molestiá bo. 

Danki. E trabou ku bo a hasi awe ta trabou duru – pero tambe e ta trabou di hopi balor. E lo yudá bo manehá bo mes strès i ta duna bo yunan e hèrmèntnan ku nan mester pa manehá esun di nan. Pasa un dia trankil i kontentu!

SourceText: Let’s see a story of parents giving praise to their child for following instructions:
text: Laga nos wak un historia di mayornan ku ta duna elogio na nan yu komo ku el a sigui instrukshonnan:

SourceText: 👋 Hey there! Welcome to Module 3 of @global.prog_name. Well done for making the time today. We will be chatting about how to help our children follow instructions.
text: 👋 Hei kon ta bai? Bon Biní na Módulo 3 di @global.prog_name. Hopi bon ku bo a traha tempu awe. Nos lo kòmbersá tokante kon nos por yuda nos yunan sigui instrukshonnan.
note: The string @global.prog_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s look at a story that shows a parent giving specific and positive instructions to their teen:
text: Laga nos wak un historia ku ta mustra kon un mayor ta duna instrukshonnan spesífiko i positivo na su tiner:

SourceText: Now let’s move on to the parenting tip. Here are 3 steps to help you to get your children to follow your instructions more often:
text: Awor laga nos sigui pa e tep di edukashon familiar. Akí tin 3 stap pa yudá bo, pa logra ku bo yunan lo sigui bo instrukshonnan ku mas frekuensia:

SourceText:
Hello! Keep spending 5 minutes of one-on-one time with your child every day. Remember to practice keeping your instructions positive, realistic, and specific and to praise your children for following instructions. 

Some of things you can praise your child for are playing quietly, talking respectfully to others, and helping with chores around the house. 

Thank you for your commitment and dedication to your children!
text:
Kon ta bai! Sigui pasa 5 minüt di Tempu pa abo ku bo yu tur dia. Kòrda praktiká Tene bo instrukshonnan positivo, realístiko i spesífiko i Elogiá bo yunan pa sigui instrukshonnan. 

Algun di e kosnan ku bo por elogiá bo yu p’e ta hunga trankil, papia ku rèspèt ku otronan i yuda ku trabounan di kas. 

Danki pa boso kompromiso i dedikashon na boso yunan!

SourceText: Hello! Can you believe that another week has gone by? Our next chat session will be later at [INSERT DATE & TIME]. We will continue chatting about how to get your children to follow instructions. Chat soon!
text: Kon ta bai! Bo por kere ku un siman mas a pasa? Nos siguiente seshon di 'chat' lo ta un djis aki riba [INSERT DATE & TIME]. Nos lo sigui kòmbersá tokante kon pa logra ku bo yunan ta sigui instrukshonnan. Nos lo 'chat' un djis!

SourceText: Welcome to Module 3 of @global.prog_name! Well done for making the time today. How is everybody doing? I am feeling [INSERT EMOTION]. Anyone else want to share?
text: Bon Biní na Módulo 3 di @global.prog_name! Hopi bon ku bo a traha tempu awe. Kon ta bai ku tur hende? Mi ta sinti [HINKA EMOSHON]. Tin otro hende ku ke kompartí?
note: The string @global.prog_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Replace [INSERT EMOTION] with what you are feeling.Allow time for parents to share how they are feeling.
text: Remplasá [HINKA EMOTION] ku loke abo ta sinti.Permití tempu pa mayornan kompartí kon nan ta sinti.

SourceText: How did your home practice go this week? As a reminder, for home practice you were going to practice giving specific, realistic, and positive instructions and praise your children when they followed an instruction. Give me a 👍🏽if you were able to give it a try!
text: Kon bo tarea pa hasi na kas a bai e siman akí? Komo un rekordatorio, pa hasi e tarea di kas bo tabata pa bai praktiká duna instrukshonnan spesífiko, realístiko i positivo i elogiá bo yunan ora nan sigui un instrukshon. Mandá mi un dùim ariba👍🏽si bo a logra purba!

SourceText:
Awesome if you had a chance to try it out! 🙌🏾 If giving clear instructions or remembering to praise your child feels a bit challenging, you’re not alone. Many caregivers find this takes practice. Check out the challenges below and pick the one you’d like us to talk through together:

1️⃣ My child did not follow my instructions, even when I used the tips. 
2️⃣ I forgot to praise my child. 
3️⃣ I shouted at my child when they behaved negatively instead of giving them a positive instruction for what they should do.
4️⃣ It is hard to remember to use positive words when giving instructions.
text:
Tremendo si bo tabatin chèns pa purba esaki! 🙌 Si bo ta sinti ku duna instrukshon kla òf kòrda elogiá bo yu ta un tiki manera un reto, bo no ta bo so. Hopi edukadó ta haña ku esaki ta rekerí práktika. Wak e retonan akí bou i skohe esun ku bo ke pa nos papia riba dje:

1️⃣ Mi yu no a sigui mi instrukshonnan, ni sikiera ora mi a usa e tepnan. 
2️⃣ Mi a lubidá di elogiá mi yu. 
3️⃣ Mi a grita mi yu ora el a komportá malu na lugá di a dun'é un instrukshon positivo pa loke e mester hasi.
4️⃣ Ta difísil pa kòrda usa palabranan positivo ora di duna instrukshon.

SourceText: Thanks for sharing that! Have you come across any other difficult situations lately? Feel free to share, this is a space where we can support one another.
text: Danki pa kompartí esei! Bo a topa ku otro situashonnan difísil últimamente? Sintí bo liber pa kompartí, esaki ta un espasio kaminda nos por sostené otro.

SourceText:
Before we end today’s module, let's take a pause together. Remember that this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed, or your children are annoying you.

Thank you for working as hard as you do as parents. The commitment you are showing to improving the lives of your children just by being here is worth the final note of praise in our module today: Truly well done.
text:
Promé ku nos finalisá e módulo di awe, ban tuma un pousa huntu. Kòrda ku esaki ta algu ku bo por hasi semper ku bo ta sintí bo di strès òf bo yunan ta molestiá bo.

Danki pa traha duru asina komo mayor. E kompromiso ku bo ta mustra pa mehorá bida di bo yunan djis dor di ta aki presente, ta bal un último nota di elogio den nos módulo di awe: Bèrdaderamente bon hasí.

SourceText: Let’s look at a story about parents making a rule about playing soccerball use with their child:
text: Laga nos wak un historia kon mayornan ta traha un regla tokante hunga futbòl ku nan yu:

SourceText: Let’s see a story of parents setting routines for bedtime:
text: Laga nos wak un historia di mayornan ku ta pone rutinanan pa ora di bai drumi:

SourceText: 👋 Welcome to Module 4 of @global.prog_name! Can you believe it that we are already more than halfway through the programme? Well done for making it this far! Today we will be chatting about how to keep our children safe by creating household rules and daily routines.
text: 👋 Bon Biní na Módulo 4 di @global.prog_name! Bo por kere ku nos ta, na mas ku mitar di e programa kaba? Bon trabou pa yega asina leu! Awe nos lo kombersá riba kon pa tene nos muchanan seif dor di krea reglanan di kas i rutinanan diario.
note: The string @global.prog_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s look at a story about parents making a rule about tablet use with their teen:
text: Laga nos wak un historia tokante mayornan ku ta traha un regla pa uso di tèblet ku nan tiner:

SourceText: Now let’s move on to today’s parent tip. Here are 4 steps you can take to help your children follow household rules and routines:
text: Awor laga nos pasa pa e tep di mayor di awe. Akí tin 4 stap ku bo por tuma pa yuda bo yunan sigui reglanan i rutinanan di kas:

SourceText:
Hello! You should try to involve your children and other members of your household when making new rules and routines. These can be around bedtime, schoolwork or chores. 

It is perfectly normal for children to test out rules before making them a normal part of the routine. Soon these rules and routines will just feel like a normal part of your household and day. Daily routines can help create a sense of security in the household. 

Thank you!
text:
Kon ta bai! Bo mester purba di enbolbí bo yunan i otro miembronan di kas ora di traha regla i rutinanan nobo. Esakinan por ta rònt di ora di bai drumi, hùiswèrk òf hasi trabou di kas. 

Ta mashá normal pa muchanan tèst reglanan promé ku nan bira parti normal di e rutina. Pronto e reglanan i rutinanan aki lo djis sinti manera un parti normal di bo hogar i di bo dia. Rutinanan diario por yuda krea un sentido di seguridat den kas. 

Danki!

SourceText: Welcome to Module 4 of @global.prog_name! How is everybody doing? Describe what you are feeling today, where you feel it in your body and what thoughts you associate with the feeling.
text: Bon Biní na Módulo 4 di @global.prog_name! Kon ta bai ku tur hende? Deskribí kiko bo ta sinti awe, unda bo ta sintié den bo kurpa i kua pensamentunan bo ta asosiá ku e sintimentu.
note: The string @global.prog_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Allow time for parents to share how they are feeling.
text: Permití tempu pa mayornan kompartí kon nan ta sinti.

SourceText: Last week we looked at making rules and routines with your children. Please send a thumbs up 👍🏽if you were able to try to create one household rule and one routine with your children.
text: Siman pasá nos a wak kon pa traha reglanan i rutinanan ku nos yunan. Por fabor manda un dùim ariba 👍🏽si bo por a purba traha un regla di kas i un rutina ku bo yunan.

SourceText:
Great if you were able to give it a go! 🙌🏾 If coming up with a household rule or setting a routine felt a little tough, you’re definitely not the only one. Lots of caregivers are figuring it out too. Take a look at the challenges below and choose the one you’d like us to chat about together:

1️⃣ We were not able to stick to the rule
2️⃣ My child and I could not agree on a rule
3️⃣ I felt uncomfortable, because I feel parents should be the one establishing the rule not my child
4️⃣ Another caregiver at home didn’t agree with the rule
text:
Hopi bon, si bo a logra purba! 🙌 Si bo a haña un tiki difísil pa traha un regla di kas òf pone un rutina, bo no ta e úniko. Hopi edukadó tambe ta deskubrí esaki. Tira un bista riba e retonan akí bou i skohe esun ku bo ke pa nos kòmbersá riba dje huntu:

1️⃣Nos no tabata por a tene nos mes na regla
2️⃣Ami ku mi yu no por a bai di akuerdo riba un regla
3️⃣Mi a sintí mi inkómodo, pasobra mi ta sinti ku ta mayor mester ta esun ku ta pone regla, no mi yu
4️⃣Un otro edukadó na kas no tabata di akuerdo ku e regla

SourceText: Choose the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible challenges and solutions.
text: Skohe e reto ku mas voto. Enkurashá mayornan pa traha huntu pa identifiká solushonnan positivo. Akí tin algun posibel reto i solushon.

SourceText:
Before we end today’s module let’s take a pause together. Remember that this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed, or your children are annoying you.

Thank you so much for a wonderful session. I hope the rules and routines you introduce into your homes help make your household more manageable. Have a peaceful and happy day!
text:
Promé ku nos finalisá e módulo di awe ban Tuma un Pousa huntu. Kòrda ku esaki ta algu ku bo por hasi semper ora bo ta sintí bo di strès òf bo yunan ta iritá bo.

Mashá danki pa un seshon maravioso. Mi ta spera ku e reglanan i rutinanan ku boso ta introdusí den boso kasnan, lo yuda boso manehá boso hogar mas mihó. Pasa un dia trankil i kontentu!

SourceText: Let’s look at how parents can use consequences with their children and teens:
text: Laga nos wak kon mayornan por usa konsekuenshanan ku nan yunan i tinernan:

SourceText: Let’s look at a story that shows how you can redirect your children from negative to positive behaviours before they get worse.
text: Laga nos wak un historia ku ta mustra kon bo por desviá atenshon di bo yunan di komportashonnan negativo pa komportashon positivo promé ku nan bira pió.

SourceText: 👋 Welcome to Module 5 of @global.prog_name! This week, we’ll talk about positive discipline – calm, practical and positive ways to respond when our children misbehave. It’s not about letting children do whatever they want. Positive discipline helps us guide our children while building a stronger relationship.
text: 👋 Bon Biní na Módulo 5 di @global.prog_name! E siman akí, nos lo papia tokante disiplina positivo – maneranan trankil, práktiko i positivo pa reakshoná ora nos yunan ta komportá nan mes malu. No ta trata aki di laga muchanan hasi loke nan ke. Disiplina positivo ta yuda nos guia nos yunan miéntras nos ta konstruí un relashon mas fuerte.
note: The string @global.prog_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Let’s look at how parents can use consequences with their children:
text: Laga nos wak kon mayornan por usa konsekuensia ku nan yunan:

SourceText: Now let’s chat about today’s parent tip - how to respond with positive discipline when children misbehave. Here are 3 steps you can follow:
text: Awor laga nos kòmbersá tokante e tep di mayor di awe - kon pa reakshoná ku disiplina positivo ora muchanan ta komportá nan mes malu. Akí tini 3 stap ku bo por sigui:

SourceText: Hello! Remember that using new ways to discipline your children takes practice! Try to make sure that consequences should be fair and realistic. They are best used when your child forgets a household rule or refuses to follow an instruction.
text: Kon ta bai! Kòrda ku ta rekerí práktika pa usa maneranan nobo pa disipliná bo yunan! Purba di sòru pa konsekuensianan ta hustu i realístiko. E mihó momentu pa usa esakinan ta ora bo yu lubidá un regla di kas òf nenga di sigui un instrukshon.
Rekordatorio di tarea pa hasi na kas

SourceText: It is really important to remember to Keep It Positive! Continue to spend quality time with your children, use positive instructions, and praise them when they are behaving well. The more positive attention they receive for good behaviour, the less you will have to discipline them!
text: Ta realmente importante pa kòrda pa Keda Positivo! Sigui pasa tempu di kalidat ku bo yunan, usa instrukshonnan positivo i elogiá nan ora nan ta komportá nan mes bon. Mas atenshon positivo nan haña pa bon komportashon, ménos bo lo mester disipliná nan!
Solisitut pa administradó nobo

SourceText: As we start thinking ahead beyond the end of the programme, would anyone like to consider taking on the administrator role for our chat group? DM if you are interested! Thank you!
text: Segun ku nos ta kuminsá pensa delantá, riba kon ta sigui despues ku finalisá e programa, tin hende ku ke konsiderá tuma e ròl di atministradó pa nos grupo di 'chat'? Manda un mensahe personal si bo ta interesá! Danki!

SourceText: Message 3: Voting on a challenge to discuss
text: Mensahe 3: Vota riba un reto pa diskutí

SourceText:
Well done if you tried it out! 🙌🏾 If coming up with a behaviour and consequence felt challenging, you’re not alone. Many caregivers are still practicing this skill too. Have a look at the challenges below and pick the one you’d like us to explore together:

1️⃣ I am too angry to find anything positive to say to my child after they have misbehaved.
2️⃣ I got very angry with my child and shouted at them.
3️⃣ I forgot to give my child a chance to do what I asked before giving the consequence.
4️⃣ My child got very angry with me after I gave the consequence for their misbehaviour.
text:
Hopi bon, si bo a purba! 🙌🏾 Si bo a sintié komo un reto pa bin ku un komportashon i konsekuensia, bo no ta bo so. Hopi edukadó ketu bai tambe ta praktiká e abilidat akí. Tira un bista riba e retonan akí bou i skohe esun ku bo ke pa nos papia riba dje huntu:

1️⃣ Mi ta muchu rabiá pa haña algu positivo pa bisa mi yu despues ku el a komportá su mes malu.
2️⃣ Mi a rabia hopi ku mi yu i a grit'é.
3️⃣ Mi a lubidá di duna mi yu un chèns pa hasi loke mi a pidi promé ku duna e konsekuensia.
4️⃣ Mi yu a rabia hopi ku mi despues ku mi a duna e konsekuensia pa su mal komportashon.
Mensahe 4: Diskutí riba solushon

SourceText: Can we work together to think of a positive solution to [name challenge]?
text: Nos por traha huntu pa pensa riba un solushon positivo pa [nombra reto]?

SourceText: Replace [name challenge] with the challenge with the highest vote. Encourage parents to work together to identify positive solutions. Here are some possible challenges and solutions.
text: Remplasá [nòmber di reto] ku e reto ku a haña mas voto. Enkurashá mayornan pa traha huntu pa identifiká solushonnan positivo. Akí tin algun posibel reto i solushon.
Mensahe 5: Habri Komentario

SourceText: Thanks for opening up! Have there been any other moments that felt challenging recently? Don’t hesitate to share, this is a space where we’re all here to help each other.
text: Danki pa habri boso mes! Tabatin otro momentunan ku a sinti komo un reto resientemente? No duda pa kompartí, esaki ta un espasio kaminda nos tur tei pa yuda otro.
Mensahe 6: Tuma un Pousa

SourceText:
Before we end today’s module let’s take a short pause together. Remember that this is something you can do whenever you are feeling stressed or overwhelmed. You can also do it to appreciate a positive moment, too! 

What a wonderful session! Have a peaceful and happy day!
text:
Prome ku nos terminá e módulo di awe ban tuma un pousa kòrtiku hunto. Kòrda ku esaki ta algu ku bo por hasi semper ku bo ta sinti bo mes di strès òf ku hopi kos na bo kabes. Bo por hasié pa apresiá un momentu positivo tambe! 

Ki seshon maravioso! Pasa un dia trankil i kontentu!

SourceText: 👋Welcome to our last week of @global.prog_name! Today we are going to learn about how to solve problems with our children and reflect on what we have learned in the programme.
text: 👋Bon biní na nos último siman di @global.prog_name! Awe nos ta ban siña kon pa solushoná problema ku nos muchanan i reflehá riba loke nos a siña den e programa.
note: The string @global.prog_name! should not be translated.

SourceText: Now let’s move on to the final parenting tip on problem solving with your children. We have been doing this throughout the programme. Now it is time to learn how we can involve our children in the process! Here are the 4 basic steps for problem solving:
text: Awor laga nos sigui ku e último tep di edukashon familiar kon pa solushoná problema ku bo yunan. Nos a bin ta hasi esaki durante henter e programa. Awor ta tempu pa siña kon nos por hinka nos muchanan den e proseso! Akí ta sigui e 4 stapnan básiko pa solushoná problema:
Rekordatorio di abilidatnan

SourceText: Congratulations! I wanted to share an audio message that might help you reflect on all of the things we explored in the @global.programme_name.
text: Pabien! Mi ke kompartí un mensahe di oudio ku por yudá bo reflehá riba tur e kosnan ku nos a trata den e programa @global.programme_name.
note: The string @global.programme_name. should not be translated.

SourceText: Send this message with the audio recording
text: Manda e mensahe akí ku e grabashon di oudio
Rekordatorio di tareanan pa hasi na kas

SourceText:
Even though the programme is ending soon, our parenting work continues! Remember to continue practising all of the skills that we have learned together. The main ones are:

1️⃣ Spend one-on-one time with your children. Just 5 minutes a day can make a difference

2️⃣ Praise your children when they are behaving well

3️⃣ Keep it positive with positive instructions

4️⃣ Have consistent household rules and daily routines (including time for play!)

5️⃣ Practice positive discipline with redirect and consequences

6️⃣ Involve  your child in solving problems together.

7️⃣ Take 5 deep breaths or a Pause when you are feeling stressed or angry.
text:
Ounke e programa ta serka di kaba, nos trabou di edukashon familiar ta sigui! Kòrda sigui praktiká tur e abilidatnan ku nos a siña huntu. Esunnan prinsipal ta:

1️⃣Pasa tempu abo ku bo yunan. Djis 5 minüt pa dia por hasi un diferensia

2️⃣Elogiá bo yunan ora nan ta komportá nan mes bon

3️⃣Mantené esaki positivo ku instrukshonnan positivo

4️⃣Sòru pa bo tin reglanan di kas konsistente i rutinanan diario (inkluyendo ora di hunga!)

5️⃣Praktiká disiplina positivo dor di desviá atenshon i duna konsekuensianan.

6️⃣Enbolbí bo yu den solushoná problemanan huntu.

7️⃣Hala 5 rosea profundo of tuma un Pousa ora bo ta sinti strès òf rabia.

SourceText: Allow time for parents to share. You should also share how you are feeling. For example, “I am excited to be part of the chat today, and I feel that excitement in my heart.”
text: Permití tempu pa mayornan kompartí. Bo tambe mester kompartí kon bo ta sinti. Por ehèmpel, “Mi ta entusiasmá pa ta parti di e kòmbersashon awe i mi ta sinti e emoshon ei den mi kurason.”

SourceText: Since we are having our last chat session, let’s take a few moments to reflect on our experience during the programme. Let’s share some of the things that we learned from the programme or ways that we and our children have changed.
text: Komo ku nos tin nos último seshon di 'chat', laga nos tuma algun momentu pa reflehá riba nos eksperensia durante e programa. Laga nos kompartí algun di e kosnan ku nos a siña for di e programa òf maneranan ku nos i nos yunan a kambia.

SourceText: Give parents time to reflect and respond. You can encourage everyone to have a chance to write something in the chat. Remember to thank each parent for their contribution. If no parents respond, you can prompt by asking parents to share something they are proud of, or something that surprised them.
text: Duna mayornan tempu pa reflehá i reakshoná. Bo por enkurashá tur hende pa haña chèns di skibi algu den e 'chat'. Kòrda gradisí kada mayor pa nan aporte. Si niun mayor no kontestá, bo por pidi mayornan pa kompartí algu ku nan ta orguyoso di dje òf algu ku a sorprendé nan.
Mensahe 3: Sòpi di Piedra

SourceText: Thank you for sharing. Now you can sit back and enjoy a story that we have shared at the end of all of our parenting programmes.
text: Danki pa kompartí. Awor bo por sinta i disfrutá di un kuenta ku nos a kompartí na final di tur nos programanan di edukashon familiar.

text: Mensahe 4: Diskushon tokante e sòpi di piedra

Mensahe 6: Danki & klousura

SourceText:
Let’s close with an activity that is similar to Taking a Pause. Since it is the last module of the programme, we take this opportunity to reconnect with ourselves and our families through a sense of love and support.

Thank you and well done for completing the ParentChat programme! You have shown great love and commitment to your families by being here. It has been a pleasure to be on this journey with you.
text:
Laga nos sera ku un aktividat ku ta similar na Tuma un Pousa. Komo ku ta e último módulo di e programa, nos ta probechá di e oportunidat akí pa rekonektá ku nos mes i nos famianan pa medio di un sentido di amor i sosten.

Danki i boso a hasi un bon trabou pa a kompletá e programa di Mayor Konektá! Boso a mustra gran amor i kompromiso na boso famianan dor di ta aki. Tabata un plaser pa ta riba e biahe aki ku boso.

Here’s your certificate to celebrate your dedication and commitment as a parent. We’re so proud of the love, effort, and learning you’ve put into this journey. Keep going, you’re making a real difference for your family!

SourceText: Key issues to be aware of:
text: Asuntunan klave pa tene kuenta kuné:

SourceText: Participants share that the programme was not helpful or that they are still struggling
text: Partisipantenan ta kompartí ku e programa no tabata útil òf ku nan ta lucha ketu bai

text: Mayornan ta sinti nan mes preokupá, di strès òf tristu segun ku e programa ta yega na su fin.

SourceText: A parent cannot commit to the ground rules.
text: Un mayor no por komprometé su mes ku e reglanan básiko.

SourceText: A parent is personally messaging me or calling me with lots of questions on their parenting habits or child’s misbehaviours.
text: Un mayor ta mandá mi mensahenan personal òf ta yamá mi ku hopi pregunta tokante su kustumbernan di edukashon familiar òf e mal komportashon di e yu.

SourceText: Only a small group of parents are actively participating in the chat sessions, while other parents are not responding.
text: Solamente un grupo chikí di mayor ta partisipá aktivamente den e seshonnan di kòmbersashon, miéntras ku otro mayornan no ta kontestá.
Kiko ta pasa si niun hende no partisipá?
Promé chèk
Di dos chèk
Di tres chèk
1️⃣ Mi no tabatin sufisiente tempu

SourceText:
It can be hard to find time during your day, with work, chores, and everything else. 

✨Think of a time each day that you could spare 5 minutes. You can even make household chores into a game to do together. 

Use the time that you and your girls and boys are already sharing, like going to the school, picking up them, waking them up or say good by for sleeping. 

You can even make household chores into a game to do together.
text:
E por ta difísil pa haña tempu durante di dia, ku trabou, trabounan di kas i tur otro kos. 

✨Pensa kua momentu di kada dia, bo por saka 5 minüt. Bo por asta hasi trabounan di kas un wega pa hasi huntu. 

Usa e tempu ku abo i bo yunan muhé i yunan hòmber ta kompartí kaba, manera ora di bai skol, buska nan, lanta nan òf duna nan bonochi promé ku bai drumi. 

Bo por asta hasi trabounan di kas un wega pa hasi huntu.

SourceText: 2️⃣ My child did not want to spend time with me
text: 2️⃣ Mi yu no tabata ke pasa tempu ku mi

SourceText:
😔 It can hurt when your child does not want to spend 1-on- time with you. 

💡 Think to yourself: When are they more open to you? In the morning? Right before bedtime?

💙 Try again so that your child can see that you care and want to spend this time with them.
text:
😔 E por duel bo si bo yu no ke pasa tempu huntu ku bo. 

💡 Pensa pa bo mes: Ki ora nan ta mas habrí pa bo? Den oranan di mainta? Djis promé ku bai drumi?

💙 Purba atrobe pa bo yu por mira ku bo ta perkurá p'e i ke pasa e tempu akí kuné.

SourceText: 3️⃣ All my child wanted to do was watch TV or play with a gadget
text: 3️⃣ Tur loke mi yu tabata ke hasi tabata wak televishon òf hunga ku un 'gadget'

SourceText:
📺Children often want to spend time watching T.V. or playing with a gadget.

❓ You could watch or play on the gadget with them.

💚Caring about their interests is a great start!

🌷 Once you begin spending time together you can suggest another activity.
text:
📺Muchanan hopi biaha ke pasa tempu wak televishon of hunga ku un 'gadget'.

❓ Bo por wak òf hunga riba e 'gadget' ku nan.

💚Mustra interes pa nan interesnan ta un bon komienso!

🌷 Unabes boso kuminsá pasa tempu huntu bo por sugeri un otro aktividat.

SourceText: 4️⃣ My child wanted to do things I felt uncomfortable about
text: 4️⃣ Mi yu tabata ke hasi kosnan ku mi tabata sinti mi inkómodo kuné

SourceText:
☀️ If your child wants to do things that are too difficult for you to do, you could watch them.

🏁If they are younger, you could describe what they are doing like a sports announcer.You can also express enthusiasm by clapping, smiling, or offering a thumbs-up. 

💛 Praise them while they do it!

📱 Sometimes older children will suggest activities that are violent or unsafe. 

🚩 Explain *why* you can't do them, and suggest a different activity.
text:
☀️ Si bo yu ke hasi kosnan ku ta muchu difísil pa bo hasi, bo por djis wak nan.

🏁Si nan ta mas yòn, bo por deskribí kiko nan ta hasi manera un lokutor di deporte. Bo por ekspresá entusiasmo tambe dor di bati man, smail òf saka un dùim ariba. 

💛 Elogiá nan tanten nan ta hasié!

📱 Tin bia muchanan mas grandi lo sugerí aktividatnan ku ta violento òf no mashá seif. 

🚩 Splika *dikon* bo no por hasi nan i sugerí un aktividat diferente.

SourceText: 1️⃣ My child did not want to share their feelings
text: 1️⃣Mi yu no tabata ke kompartí su sintimentunan

SourceText:
😣 Sharing emotions can be hard. It’s even harder when they are strong emotions!

💚 Help your teen know that you are open and willing to listen when they are ready.

👂 Remember, the most important part is just to listen to them.
text:
😣 Kompartí emoshon por ta difísil. Ta asta mas difísil ora nan ta emoshonnan fuerte!

💚 Yuda bo yu tiner sa ku bo ta habrí i dispuesto pa skucha ora e ta kla.

👂 Kòrda, e parti mas importante ta djis pa skucha nan.

SourceText: 2️⃣ I felt uncomfortable talking about my feelings
text: 2️⃣ Mi a sinti mi inkómodo pa papia tokante mi sintimentunan

SourceText:
▶️ Starting a new thing is always difficult at first. 

⏰ Give yourselves some time to get used to it, and keep giving a good example by noticing and sharing your emotions. 

💚 Over time, your teen will learn to do the same – and they will feel even more loved and cared for.
text:
▶️ Na kuminsamentu semper ta difísil pa kuminsá ku un kos nobo. 

⏰ Duna boso mes un tiki tempu pa kustumá ku esaki i sigui duna un bon ehèmpel dor di pone atenshon na boso emoshonnan i kompartí esakinan.

💚 Ku tempu, bo tiner lo siña hasi meskos – i e lo sinti su mes ainda mas stimá i kuidá.

SourceText: 3️⃣ I was afraid my child might think I am weak for sharing my own emotions.
text: 3️⃣ Mi tabatin miedu ku mi yu por a pensa ku mi ta débil pa kompartí mi mes emoshonnan.

SourceText:
💛 Sharing your emotions sets an important example for your teen - even more when sharing difficult emotions! 

🌷 It makes everyone in the family stronger, because it means you can understand and support each other better.
text:
💛 Kompartí bo emoshonnan ta duna un ehèmpel importante pa bo tiner - mas ainda si bo mester kompartí emoshonnan difísil! 

🌷 E ta hasi tur hende den famia mas fuerte, pasobra e ta nifiká ku bo por komprondé i sostené otro mihó.

SourceText: 4️⃣ I was too stressed or angry to share my emotions, I prefer to be alone when I feel like that.
text: 4️⃣Mi tabata muchu di strès òf rabiá pa kompartí mi emoshonnan, mi ta preferá di ta mi so ora mi ta sinti asina.

SourceText:
💛 It’s okay not to want to share when your feelings are strong.

🌱 When you feel calmer, find time to explain so that everyone can understand.
text:
💛 Ta oké pa no ke kompartí ora bo sintimentunan ta fuerte.

🌱 Ora bo ta sintí bo mas trankil, buska tempu pa splika ya asina tur hende por komprondé.

SourceText: 1️⃣ My child did not follow my instructions, even when I used the tips.
text: 1️⃣ Mi yu no a sigui mi instrukshonnan, ni ora mi a usa e tepnan.

SourceText: Children need time to learn to follow instructions. Be patient. Try again. Remember to praise them every time they follow an instruction.
text: Mucha mester di tempu pa siña sigui instrukshon. Tene pasenshi. Purba atrobe. Kòrda elogiá nan kada bes ku nan sigui un instrukshon.

SourceText: 2️⃣ I forgot to praise my child.
text: 2️⃣Mi a lubidá di elogiá mi yu.

SourceText: It can sometimes be hard to remember to praise our children. Next time you spend one-on-one time with your child, try and think of one thing you can praise them for. You can even say, “Thank you for spending time with me!”
text: Tin bia por ta difísil pa kòrda pa elogiá nos yunan. E siguiente biaha ku bo pasa tempu huntu abo ku bo yu, purba i pensa riba un kos ku bo por elogi'é p’e. Bo por asta bisa: “Danki pa pasa tempu ku mi!”

SourceText: 3️⃣ I shouted at my child when they behaved negatively instead of giving them a positive instruction for what they should do.
text: 3️⃣Mi a grita mi yu ora el a komportá su mes malu na lugá di dun'é un instrukshon positivo pa loke e mester hasi.

SourceText: It’s difficult to give instructions in a calm way when we are still angry. Try to find a time when you are calm or to use a calming strategy like Take a Pause before you introduce a positive instruction.
text: Ta difísil pa duna instrukshon na un manera trankil ora nos ta rabiá ainda. Purba di haña un momentu ku bo ta trankil òf usa un strategia pa kalma bo mes manera Tuma un Pousa promé ku bo introdusí un instrukshon positivo.

SourceText: 4️⃣ It is hard to remember to use positive words when giving instructions.
text: 4️⃣ Ta difísil pa kòrda usa palabranan positivo ora di duna instrukshon.

SourceText: This is difficult to remember for everyone at first! Try to take a breath before giving an instruction. Also, remember to be gentle with yourself when you forget. It happens to everyone!
text: Pa tur hende esaki ta difísil pa kòrda, na kuminsamentu ! Purba di hala rosea promé ku duna un instrukshon. Tambe, kòrda pa ta amabel ku bo mes ora bo lubidá. E ta pasa ku tur hende!

SourceText: 1️⃣ We were not able to stick to the rule
text: 1️⃣Nos no tabata por a mantené e regla

SourceText: Make sure to have a rule that can be kept easily. For example, try having one meal together every week instead of every night.
text: Sòru pa tin un regla ku ta fásil pa mantené. Por ehèmpel, purba di kome un kuminda huntu tur siman en bes di tur anochi.

SourceText: 2️⃣ My child and I could not agree on a rule
text: 2️⃣ Ami ku mi yu no por a bai di akuerdo riba un regla

SourceText:
📖 When creating rules, it is important to think about the age & ability of each teen so you can come up with realistic routines for Your Teen.

⏰ This is most important for bedtime, the time to come home, and household chores.

💡 Try to agree on a small and meaningful incentive that can motivate Your Teen to follow the rule. Consider options like watching a movie or playing a video game. 

What other ideas come to mind?
text:
📖 Ora di traha reglanan, ta importante pa pensa riba e edat i abilidat di kada tiner ya bo por bini ku rutinanan realístiko pa Bo Tiner.

⏰ Esaki ta mas importante pa ora di drumi, e orario di bin kas i trabounan di kas.

💡 Purba bai di akuerdo tokante un insentivo chikí i signifikante ku por motivá Bo Tiner pa sigui e regla. Konsiderá opshonnan manera wak un pelíkula òf hunga un wega di vidio. 

Ki otro ideanan ta bini na bo mente?

SourceText: 3️⃣ I felt uncomfortable, because I feel parents should be the one establishing the rule not my child
text: 3️⃣Mi a sintí mi inkómodo, pasobra mi ta haña ku ta mayornan mester ta esunnan ku ta disidí riba e regla, no mi yu

SourceText:
🌷 When we create rules together with our children, we build trust and an open relationship with them. 

🔑 The rules we set will be more realistic and your child will be more willing and able to follow the rules.

💡Think about the valuable lessons you’ll be teaching your child, such as working together and taking initiative. Try to start with an easy and small rule.
text:
🌷 Ora nos krea regla huntu ku nos yunan, nos ta konstruí konfiansa i un relashon habrí ku nan.

🔑 E reglanan ku nos ta pone lo ta mas realístiko i bo yu lo ta mas dispuesto i kapas pa sigui e reglanan.

💡Pensa riba e lèsnan balioso ku bo ta bai siña bo yu, manera traha huntu i tuma inisiativa. Purba kuminsá ku un regla fásil i chikí.

SourceText: 4️⃣ Another caregiver at home didn’t agree with the rule
text: 4️⃣ Un otro edukadó na kas no tabata di akuerdo ku e regla

SourceText:
I know it’s tough when other people at home don’t agree with a rule. 💙 

Try talking calmly with them when your child isn’t around. Explain why the rule matters to you (and your child). Listen to their views and try to avoid accusations or conflict. You can also share how you feel.

If it is hard to agree, remember that making the home a safe and happy place for your child starts with YOU. 

You can make rules with your child that you have control over (like “speak politely to me” or “always look both ways and hold hands when we cross the road”.

You can be a model for both your child and other adults. With time, they may see the benefits and agree with you!
text:
Mi sa ku ta duru ora otro hende na kas no ta di akuerdo ku un regla. 💙 

Purba papia trankil ku nan, ora bo yu no tei. Splika dikon e regla ta importante pa abo (i bo yu). Skucha nan punto di bista i purba di evitá akusashonnan òf konflikto. Bo por kompartí tambe kon bo ta sinti.

Si ta difísil pa yega na un akuerdo, kòrda ku hasi e kas un lugá seif i felis pa bo yu ta kuminsá serka ABO. 

Bo por traha reglanan ku bo tin kòntròl riba dje huntu ku bo yu (manera “papia nèchi ku mi” òf “semper wak tur dos banda i tene man ora nos ta krusa kaya”.

Bo por ta un ehèmpel pa tantu bo yu komo otro adultonan. Ku tempu, nan por mira e benefisionan i bai di akuerdo ku bo!

SourceText: 1️⃣ I am too angry to find anything positive to say to my child after they have misbehaved.
text: 1️⃣ Mi ta muchu rabiá pa haña algu positivo pa bisa mi yu despues ku el a komportá su mes malu.

SourceText:
⏸ Next time, when you are overwhelmed or angry, take a deep breath. If needed, walk away from the situation before you react. 

Remember, your child’s behaviour isn’t meant to hurt you. As children, it's normal for them to explore their limits. 

Later, find something small and clear that your teen is doing and you wish they could do more of. Then, praise them when they do it.
text:
⏸ Proksimo biaha, ora bo kabes ta yen òf bo ta rabiá, hala rosea profundo. Si ta nesesario, kana bai for di e situashon promé ku bo reakshoná.

Kòrda, e komportashon di bo yu no ta pa hasi bo daño. Komo mucha, ta normal pa e eksplorá su límitenan.

Despues, buska algu chikí i kla ku bo tiner ta hasi i ku bo ta deseá pa e por hasié mas. Despues, elogié ora e hasié.

SourceText: 2️⃣ I got very angry with my child and shouted at them.
text: 2️⃣ Mi a rabia hopi ku mi yu i a grita nan.

SourceText:
⏸ First, take a pause.

💚 Be kind to yourself. You are both learning and it’s okay not to get it right all the time.

If you are feeling overwhelmed or angry, take a deep breath. If needed, walk away from the situation before you react. 

Remember, your child’s behaviour isn’t meant to hurt you. As children, it's normal for them to explore their limits.

🌱 When you feel calmer, you could say sorry for shouting. Even if you meant some of what you said and want them to hear that, you can say sorry for how you said it.

🎈 Repeat the core message of what you were trying to say in a calmer way.

💛 Make them feel loved, even when you and your child are facing difficult situation.
text:
⏸ Promé, tuma un pousa.

💚 Sea amabel ku bo mes. Boso tur dos ta siña i ta oké ku e no ta bai bon tur ora.

Si bo ta sinti ku bo tin hopi kos na bo kabes òf ku bo ta rabiá, hala rosea profundo. Si ta nesesario, kana bai for di e situashon promé ku bo reakshoná.

Kòrda, e komportashon di bo yu no ta pa hasi bo daño. Komo mucha, ta normal pa nan eksplorá nan límitenan.

🌱 Ora bo ta sintí bo mas trankil, bo por bisa despensa ku bo a grita. Asta si bo tabata kier men un tiki di loke bo a bisa i ke pa nan tende esei, bo por pidi despensa pa e manera kon bo a bis’é.

🎈 Ripití e mensahe mas importante di loke bo tabata purba di bisa na un manera mas trankil.

💛 Lag'é sintié stimá, asta ora abo i bo yu ta konfrontá situashon difísil.

SourceText: 3️⃣ I forgot to give my child a chance to do what I asked before giving the consequence.
text: 3️⃣ Mi a lubidá di duna mi yu un chèns pa hasi loke mi a pidi promé ku duna e konsekuensia.

SourceText:
💚 That’s okay, this is all about learning!

Remember that the consequences should be fair and realistic. Talk about consequences for breaking household rules when you set them so your child knows them already.

✨ It does not always work, but when it does, it helps avoid giving them a consequence later!
text:
💚 Esei ta bon, esaki ta tur kos tokante siñamentu!

Kòrda ku e konsekuenshanan mester ta hustu i realístiko. Papia tokante e konsekuenshanan ora kibra ku reglanan di kas, for di na momentu ku bo ta pone e reglanan ya asina bo yu konosé nan kaba.

✨ No ta semper e ta funshoná, pero si e funshoná, e ta yuda evitá di duna nan un konsekuensha despues!

SourceText: 4️⃣ My child got very angry with me after I gave the consequence for their misbehaviour.
text: 4️⃣ Mi yu a rabia mashá ku mi despues ku mi a dun'é konsekuensha pa su mal komportashon.

SourceText:
🌷 Sometimes, your child will react in a negative way when receiving a consequence. 

✨ ✨ Give yourself and your child some space to calm down.


💡 As long as the consequence is fair, it is important to follow through with it, even if they are angry.
text:
🌷 Tin biaha, bo yu lo reakshoná na un manera negativo ora e haña un konsekuensha.

✨ ✨ Duna bo mes i bo yu un poko espasio pa boso kalma. 


💡 Tanten ku e konsekuensha ta hustu, ta importante pa sigui kuné, asta si e ta rabiá.
Posibel kontesta di mayornan:

SourceText:
We can continue to stay in touch.
We can continue to chat weekly.
We can keep practicing the Building Blocks we have learnt.
We can learn what family and parenting services are available in our community.
text:
Nos por sigui keda den kontakto.
Nos por sigui 'chat' tur siman.
Nos por sigui praktiká e Komponentenan Básiko ku nos a siña.
Nos por siña kiko ta e servisionan di famia i di edukashon familiar ku ta disponibel den nos komunidat.

SourceText:
**WELCOME (15 minutes)**
- Begin by welcoming the participants.
- Do a Name Game to help everyone get to know each other.
- Remind the group of the programme structure and content.
- Lead a short physical exercise to energize the group.
- Review the ground rules for the session.

**OVERVIEW (30 minutes)**
- Reminder of programme structure and content 
- Ground rules 
- Parent goals

**BREAK (15 min)**

**CORE LESSON: Parenting Skill – One-on-One Time (50 minutes)**
- Video Story 1 and role-play the scenario together as a big group.
- Video Story 2 and do another big group role-play.
- Discuss the benefits of spending One-on-One Time with your child.
- Brainstorm activities caregivers can do with their children during One-on-One Time.
- Practice One-on-One Time in pairs.
- Review tips for making One-on-One Time effective and enjoyable.


**HOME ACTIVITIES & CLOSING (10 minutes)**
Caregivers are encouraged to:
- Have a conversation with their child about the goals identified in the session.
- Spend at least 5 minutes each day in One-on-One Time with their child.
- Take a Pause whenever feeling stressed or upset.
- Do the Physical Exercise every morning after waking up.
For closing: 
- Review the core topics covered in the session.
- Inform caregivers about the text messages they will receive.
- Remind them about the next online session and the home activities.
- Thank and praise all participants for their contributions.
text:
**BON BINÍ (15 minüt)**
- Kuminsá dor di yama e partisipantenan bon biní.
- Hasi un Wega di Nòmber pa yuda tur hende siña konosé otro.
- Kòrda e grupo riba e struktura i kontenido di e programa.
- Guia un ehersisio físiko kòrtiku pa aktivá e grupo.
- Repasá e reglanan básiko pa e seshon.

**BISTA GENERAL (30 minüt)**
- Rekordatorio di struktura i kontenido di programa 
- Reglanan básiko 
- Metanan di mayor

**POUSA (15 min)**

**LES IMPORTANTE: Abilidat di Edukashon Familiar - Tempu pa abo ku bo yu (50 minüt)**
- Historia riba Vidio 1 i hunga e 'rollenspel' huntu komo un grupo grandi.
- Historia riba Vidio 2 i hunga un otro 'rollenspel' ku grupo grandi.
- Diskutí e benefisionan di pasa Tempu pa abo ku bo yu.
- Pensa ideanan pa aktividatnan ku edukadónan por hasi ku nan yunan durante Tempu pa abo ku bo yu.
- Praktiká Tempu pa abo ku bo yu den par.
- Repasá tepnan pa hasi Tempu pa abo ku bo yu efektivo i agradabel.


**TAREA PA HASI NA KAS & KLOUSURA (10 minüt)**
Enkurashá edukadónan pa:
- Tene un kombersashon ku nan yu tokante e metanan identifiká den e seshon.
- Pasa por lo ménos 5 minüt tur dia di Tempu pa abo ku bo yu.
- Tuma un Pousa ora bo ta sinti bo mes di strès òf alterá.
- Hasi e Ehersisio Físiko tur mainta despues di lanta.
Pa klousurá: 
- Repasá e tópikonan prinsipal ku boso a kubri den e seshon.
- Informá edukadónan tokante e mensahenan di teksto ku nan lo risibí.
- Kòrda nan tokante e siguiente seshon 'online' i e tareana pa hasi na kas.
- Gradisí i elogiá tur partisipante pa nan aporte.

**Preparation**

2️⃣ Set up the room with chairs in a circle. 

3️⃣ List all participant goals on flipchart paper ahead of time.

4️⃣ Prepare the laptop, LCD projector, and screen for showing the video story.
text:

1️⃣ Sòru pa e registro di asistensia, plachi di nòmber, teip, pèn, papel, 'flipchart', marker, ko’i hunga i asesorionan, steker i refresko pa durante di e pousa, ta kla. 
2️⃣ Prepará e kamber dor di pone e stulnan den un sírkulo. 

3️⃣ Pone tur e metanan di e partisipantenan riba papel di 'flipchart' di antemano.

4️⃣ Prepará e lèptòp, proyèktòr di LCD i pantaya pa mustra e historia riba vidio.

SourceText:
You may want to close your eyes and sit comfortably while you listen to this message.

Take a moment to think about what your lives and children were like before the programme began.

Now think about each of the parts of the ParentChat programme:

Spending One-on-One time with your child

Talking about feelings

Keeping it positive with praise and instructions

Involving your children in making household rules and daily routines

Using positive discipline like redirect and consequences

Involving your children in solving problems

Think about how the things you learned during the programme were different from the way you interacted with your children before the programme.

Think about how you have changed, how your relationship to your children has changed, and how your children’s behaviours have changed.

When you are ready, you can open your eyes.
text:
Podisé lo bo ke sera bo wowo i sinta kómodamente miéntras bo ta skucha e mensahe akí.

Tuma un ratu pa pensa kon boso bida i yunan tabata promé ku e programa a kuminsá.

Awor pensa riba kada un di e partinan di e programa di Mayor Konektá:

Pasa Tempu abo ku bo yu

Papia tokante sintimentunan

Mantené esaki positivo ku elogio i instrukshonnan

Enbolbí bo yunan den traha reglanan di kas i rutinanan diario

Usa disiplina positivo, manera desviá atenshon i konsekuensianan

Enbolbí bo yunan den kon solushoná problema

Pensa riba kon e kosnan ku bo a siña durante e programa tabata diferente for di e manera ku bo a interkambiá ku bo yunan promé ku e programa.

Pensa kon bo a kambia, kon bo relashon ku bo yunan a kambia, i kon komportashon di bo yunan a kambia.

Ora bo ta kla, bo por habri bo wowo.

SourceText: At this stage, please introduce the new administrator of the group. If time permits, suggest that the group make a concrete plan about when they would next like to meet.
text: Den e fase akí, por fabor introdusí e atministradó nobo di e grupo. Si tempu ta permití, sugerí pa e grupo traha un plan konkreto tokante ki ora nan lo ke topa otro.

SourceText:
At the end of the programme, we celebrate parents’ hard work and commitment by giving them a digital certificate. 

Parents who have attended more than 4 sessions automatically qualify. Your supervisor will already see who is eligible on the dashboard and prepare the certificates. 

Your role is simple but meaningful: you get to personally hand over these certificates and cheer parents on for their achievement!
text:
Na final di e programa, nos ta selebrá e trabou duru i kompromiso di mayornan dor di duna nan un sertifikado digital.

Mayornan ku a asistí na mas ku 4 seshon ta kualifiká outomátikamente. Bo supervisor lo a wak kaba riba e 'dashboard' ken ta bin na remarke i ta prepará e sertifikadonan.

Bo ròl ta simpel pero signifikante: bo ta haña chèns pa entregá e sertifikadonan akí personalmente i elogiá mayornan pa nan logro!

SourceText:
1️⃣ **Review reports**: Take a quick look at your group’s reports and make sure you have filled the attendance accurately. This helps make sure no parent misses out. 

2️⃣ **Reach out to your supervisor**: Let your supervisor know the program has finished and that parents in your group are ready for certificates. This gives them a heads-up to prepare the files for you.

3️⃣ **Receive certificates from your supervisor**: Your supervisor will generate the certificates for all eligible parents. They’ll share the ready digital copies (PDF or image) with you.
text:
1️⃣ **Repasá rapòrtnan**: Tira un bista rápido riba e rapòrtnan di bo grupo i sòru pa bo a yena e asistensia korektamente. Esaki ta yuda sigurá ku ningun mayor ta kai afó. 

2️⃣ **Tuma kontakto ku bo supervisor**: Laga bo supervisor sa ku e programa a kaba i ku mayornan den bo grupo ta kla pa risibí sertifikado. Esaki ta dun'é un chèns pa prepará e failnan pa bo.

3️⃣ **Risibí sertifikado di bo supervisor**: Bo supervisor lo generá e sertifikadonan pa tur mayor ku ta bini na remarke. E lo kompartí e kopianan digital ku ta kla (PDF òf imágen) ku bo.

3️⃣ Ensure you have access to music (for the dance party).
4️⃣ Don’t forget the completion certificates!

5️⃣ Set up the room with chairs in a circle.

2️⃣ Bo mester di papel i krayon pa e aktividat di arte!
